loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Ruth has been in this business for four years. Ruth earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Tazagul

texts.en:
Tazagul is married but doesn’t have any children. 

She has been involved in her cattle-breeding business for 20 years. She sells the milk products at the village and the calves to the butchers. She owns the area where she plants potatoes and keeps chickens in her yard.

Tazagul wants to obtain 1,000 Azerbaijan new manats (AZN) to buy two calves. The income from the expansion of the business will be very useful for her family.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Ruvelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Ruvelyn has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Ruvelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Rachel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Rachel would like to save enough money to expand her food stall at the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 36 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a hardware store and sells gas cylinders to earn a living. He has been in the business for six years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he does farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of rice grains business in the Philippines. Genalyn has been in this business for three years, and she earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buying and selling of rice grains business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 41 years old, married and has two children. 

He runs a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has employed two people. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. 

He has applied for 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 30, 26 and 20. 

In 2002, Kadiatu established her motor vehicle spare parts business. She began her business because there was no one to take care of her schooling. Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 980,000 every month from this business. 

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more spare parts, like oil filters, clutch plates and engine oil, in a very large quantity.  In the future, Kadiatu plans to open a bigger outlet to be managed by her husband.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy spare parts

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Mohamed from Waterloo - the eastern area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with 1 child aged 2 years. 

In 2005, Mohamed established his timber business and has 2 employees working for him. His other source of income comes from renting out a house.

Mohamed first gained experience with this business when he was living with his uncle. In 2005, he decided to start his own business because he saw that the business was profitable. He works at the business from 7 am until 8 pm, 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge is transportation cost. 

Mohamed requires a loan in order to purchase more power-saw machines. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to educate his child. In the future, Mohamed plans to open timber industries. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more power-saw machines.

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 27 years old, married, and has four children. Two of them are in school.

Ginalyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ginalyn has been farming vegetables for eight years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ginalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Ginalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 32 years old and married. She has one child.

Joanne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Joanne requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell. She has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Joanne aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and married. She has three children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

Josephine requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dembereldorj

texts.en:
Dembereldorj, 46, runs a small computer game center in a rental house. Actually, his main job is as a driver and he provides passengers with intercity transportation. But he wanted to start a second business - a computer game center. He has been running his new business for half a year. At first, he started it with just three personal computers and now he owns six computers. He tries to expand his business day by day. Having more computers will give him the opportunity to increase his business earnings. His wife sometimes works instead of him in his game center when he runs his transportation business.

Now Dembereldorj is requesting a loan to purchase more computers for his computer game center to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more computers for his computer game center to expand his business.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet, 25, lives with her spouse and three children in her own home in the Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She is a local farmer who grows rice on the existing farmland. She has been in this business for eight years. Her spouse works in the same business and shares responsibility for the family.  He also works as a village health worker.

Chet is requesting a loan of US $300 for her husband to purchase medical devices and stocks of medicine for his medical business. This loan will be useful for her family and other villagers who need medical treatment from her husband.

loans.use: to purchase medical devices and stocks of medicine for her husband's medical business.

loans.name: Sân

texts.en:
Sân is 35 years old and a mother of three school-aged children. Her daily income mainly depends on the cultivation of crops. She works on her own farmland, which she inherited from her parents. She has been in this business for almost seven years. Her business is located in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province.

To attain her business goal, she would like to take out a loan to hire people to till the land and buy farming inputs such as rice seeds and fertilizers. She wants to start working early this year because of the rainy season. She is very happy to receive a loan to help her improve her business gradually. Her plan is to expand her business, renovate her house, and send her children to university after they finish high school.

loans.use: to hire people to till the land and buy farming inputs such as rice seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past three years, he has operated a motor vehicle transport business to earn a living and he has employed two people. Daniel earns extra income as a farmer. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business.

Daniel is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his car. In the future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare vehicle parts

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 40 years old and lives in the Gardabani District, East Georgia, with her family: her husband, Mubariz, and their 19- and 21-year-old children.  Naila earns a living through agriculture. She and her family run a dairy farm with eight milk cows and 13 calves. Naila sells milk to local dairy companies and the family sells calves in the village. Their total average monthly is 1,000 GEL. 

Naila is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed. She will purchase hay and use it for feeding livestock through May after which she will sell her calves. Nalia will reinvest the profits from her loan into the further development of her dairy farm, in particular to purchase additional milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her cows and calves

loans.name: Syphrose

texts.en:
Syphrose is 49 years old and married with six children. For the past 11 years, she has sold curtains to earn a living and has employed one person. Syphrose describes her business environment as busy because many people visit her daily. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to educate her children.

Syphrose is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to buy curtains to sell. In the future, she hopes to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy curtains to sell

loans.name: Oretha M.

texts.en: Oretha is 32 years and lives in Air Port Community, she is married with 3 children between the ages of 7 and 16, all of whom live at home and attend school.  For the past 7 years she has been operating a drugs store where she sells paracetamol and other drugs in in her community, she started this business with money given to her by her husband and enjoys the way customers respond to her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more drugs like paracetamols(drugs used for headache) and others drugs for her business, in the future she wants to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs like paracetamols (drugs used for headache) and others drugs for her business

loans.name: Mercedes Asteria

texts.es:
Mercedes es una mujer muy luchadora,  su constante dedicación y apoyo ha logrado que pueda progresar y que junto a su esposo pueda sacar adelante a sus pequeños de 17 y 11 años, por los cuales luchan diariamente, con el fin de hacerlo crecer felices y convertirlos en grandes personas de éxito.

Actualmente Mercedes se dedica a vender comidas preparadas, las cuales puede ofrecer en pequeños eventos de su comunidad. Ella nos comenta que es muy feliz poniendo de su parte para generar los ingresos que su familia necesita, también se siente contenta porque las personas a las que le vende sus productos siempre le agradecen por el buen servicio y la buena sazón que ofrece en sus platos.

Mercedes está muy agradecida con su madre, ya que fue ella quien le enseño sobre la elaboración de estos deliciosos platos, y ahora es la actividad que le permite llevar un plato de comida a su vivienda.

Mercedes tiene el gran sueño de poder remodelar su cocina, haciendo los acabados que necesita, de esta manera sentirá que trabaja en lugar mucho más limpio y adecuado. Con esta nueva motivación desea incrementar su ingresos y algún día poner su tan soñado restaurant, lo que le permitirá que sus hijos se conviertan en grandes personas profesionales.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a very tenacious woman.  With her constant dedication and support she has managed to be able to make progress.  Together with her husband she is able to get her children, ages 17 and 11 ahead.  It is for the children that they struggle every day in order for them to grow up happy and become great people who are successful.

Mercedes currently sells prepared food that she sells at small events in her community.  She tells us that she is very happy doing her part to generate the income that her family needs.  Also, she is happy because the people that she sells her products to always thank her for the good service and the good flavor of her dishes.

Mercedes is very grateful to her mother as she is the one who taught her to make these delicious dishes.  Now this business activity is what allows her to bring food to her home.

Mercedes has a big dream of remodeling her kitchen and making the finishings that it needs.  This way she will feel like she is working in a much cleaner and suitable place.

With this new motivation she wishes to increase her income and one day set up the restaurant of her dreams.  That would allow her children to become great professional people.

loans.use: to remodel her kitchen.

loans.name: Mariyi

texts.es:
Mariyi es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada y con un hijo a su cargo. Su domicilio propio está ubicado en el Caserío Cruce de Vega, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Mariyi vive en la zona rural del distrito, y no cuenta con servicios básicos.
La actividad a la que se dedica es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino y aves de corral)los cuales al alcanzar su tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es vigilante y presta servicios en el Banco de la Nación de Tambogrande, recibiendo de esa labor un sueldo mensualmente.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 1500 nuevos soles, que serán utilizados para la implementación de un nuevo dormitorio en su casa, puesto que el espacio en ella es reducido y necesitan una habitación para su hijo.
texts.en:
Mariyi is 26 years old and is married with a son in her care. Her own house is located in the Cruce de Vega village in the district of Tambogrande. Mariyi lives in the rural part of the district and does not have basic services.

She raises small livestock (sheep and poultry), which she sells in the local market when they reach their ideal size and weight. Her husband is a security guard and works for the Tambogrande National Bank. He receives a monthly salary for this work. 

The amount of the loan requested is 1500 nuevos soles, which will be used to install a new bedroom in her house, since the space inside is limited and they need a room for her son.

loans.use: to install a new bedroom in her house

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past 13 years, she has run a retail shop to earn a living and has employed one person. Judith describes her business environment as favorable because she has limited competition. To earn extra income, she is a farmer. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Judith has been able to save her income.

Judith is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, tea leaves, and cereal to sell. In the future, she hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil, tea leaves, and sugar to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 11 years and has employed two people.  He describes his business environment as good because he has many customers who visit him regularly.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has applied for 70,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil, and sodas for resale.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and sodas for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, married, and has four children.  He runs a photography shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for 15 years and has employed two people.  He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy two digital cameras.

loans.use: To buy 2 digital cameras

loans.name: Misha

texts.en:
Misha is 55 years old.  He lives in the town of Meghri, in the south of Armenia, with his wife, Elmira, and son, Artur.  Misha works as a driver.  Two years ago he got involved in agriculture and started to breed cattle.  Now Misha  wants to increase the number of cattle he has and develop his farm.  With the help of this loan he plans to purchase four cows and forage to feed them.  

Misha dreams of having a big farm, where he will keep other types of cattle, too.  The current expansion of the farm allows him to gather more income and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Beniko, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures, de poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures, du poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente YIRIDJE, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 15 kilos de poisson avec les fournisseurs de Tingolé pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The women of the Sabougnouman group are all married, averaging 34 years of age with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Beniko, in the Fana subprefecture. They met through relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell condiments, shoes, fish, and soap. The women of the Sabougnouman group are on their fifth group loan, which will be used to buy condiments, shoes, fish, and soap. 

The client, YIRIDJE, second from the left in the photo, plans to buy 15 kg of fish from suppliers in Tingolé. She will then sell the fish locally in the village to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family. Part of the profit will be reinvested in her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Nicholus

texts.en:
Nicholus is 28 years old, married, and has one child.  He sells used shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as conducive because there is limited competition.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 35,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 39 years old.  He lives in Artabuynk village with his family: mother, wife, and three children.  Davit is an accountant at the local village hall.  Besides that, he has been running a grocery store.  Being a very hard-working  man with initiative, Davit also started running a farm, where he currently breeds two cows.  

As there are favorable conditions to develop the farm, Davit would like to increase the number of cattle and start breeding sheep, too.  With the help of this loan Davit plans to purchase a cow and eight sheep.  This will allow Davit to make his farm more profitable.  

An increase of income means better opportunities for Davit to insure an economically stable future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and eight sheep

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Piruz

texts.en:
Piruz is 43 years old. She lives in Yerevan with her father and three sons. One of Piruz's sons is a trader, and the other two work in construction. Piruz rents a booth in one of the city markets to trade clothing. She works in one of the busiest markets in the city with a big number of clients. Piruz has attracted large number of customers due to her high quality services. 

Piruz is requesting a loan to purchase clothing and increase the variety of clothing for her customers. Expanding her business will allow her to increase her income. This will help her to support her sons and their families in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Teriya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Beniko, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Teriya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures et du savon.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente AWA, première, personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter  10 paquets de cube Magies, une  grosses boite  de concentrée de tomate et ½ sac de sel de cuisine, avec les revendeurs de Tingolé pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the Teriya group are all married, averaging 35 years of age with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Beniko, in the Fana subprefecture. They were introduced to one another by relatives, neighbors, and friends. They sell condiments, shoes, and soap. The women of the Teriya group are on their fourth group loan, which will be used to buy condiments, shoes, and soap. 

The client, AWA, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo, plans to buy 10 packets of Maggie cubes, one large can of tomato purée, and 1/2 bag of cooking salt from sellers in Tingolé. She will then sell them locally in the village to a clientele made up of women and men.

She plans to make an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA which will be used to meet the needs of her family. Part of the profit will be reinvested in her condiment-selling business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 27 years old.  He is married and lives with family members, three of whom work.

Hassan has owned a store since 2009.  He sells construction materials. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He decided to apply for a $3000 as "youth loan" in order to pay the annual rent for his store and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life as a whole.

loans.use: In order to pay the annual rent for his store and to add more inventories.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 24 years old.  He is single and lives with four family members, one of whom is currently working.

Khaled is a barber.  In 2008, he opened his own shop where he offers shaving and massage services. He has sufficient experience and has a good reputation.  His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

Khaled is requesting $2000 as "youth loan" to repair his shop’s walls and floors. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: repair his barber shop

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 21 years old and single. He lives with three family members, all of whom work.

Hasan has been an owner of a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knowledge about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1,500 youth loan. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, to make an outdoor ceiling, and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 29 years old.  He is married and has three children.

Haydar has owned a shop since 2008, selling electrical generators and spare parts. He has sufficient experience, a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation. He is well-known in the surrounding areas.

Haydar is requesting a $3000 as "youth loan" in order to renovate and paint his shop and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: renovate his shop and buy more inventory

loans.name: Karar

texts.en: Karar is from Iraq; he is a youth client at 23 years old. Karar is single and lives with three family members. Karar has been the owner of a food market, selling soft drinks, juices, groceries, cheese, frozen beef, chicken, fish, and dairy products, since 2006. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and is well known in the surrounding areas. Karar is requesting a $3000 youth loan in order to expand his market and add more foodstuffs. He hopes to increase his profits, which would enable him to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to expand his market and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 28 years old, married, and has two children.

Since 2007, Hussein has been the owner of a shop selling household items. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1800 "Youth loan" in order to make two sliding doors. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make two sliding doors.

loans.name: Bathuu

texts.en:
Bathuu is a 34-year-old man who lives with his wife and son in the Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. His son studies at the secondary school. Bathuu began creating wooden products in 2006 and has been been making wooden products at his home since then. His wife trades the products he makes at the trade center. Bathuu's business has expanded significantly and he bought a truck and a small van for both the business and family needs. Bathuu is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to expand the business by buying some materials for the business so that I could create more and sell them in wholesale."

Bathuu is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to buy materials.

loans.use: to buy materials

loans.name: Chamroen

texts.en:
Chamroen is a 49-year-old farmer. Rice farming is the main part of the family’s income. Chamroen describes herself as a poorly-educated woman and a humble farmer who is very diligent about her daily work to insure a sustainable living for her four single children.

Chamroen is requesting a loan to rent a plot of farmland, pay to have it plowed, and buy seed and fertilizer, including pesticide, for her rice crops. Chamroen's dream is to own a large plot of farmland and produce a sustainable harvest from her rice fields.

loans.use: to rent land and cultivate rice

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Batmunh is a 48-year-old man who lives with his wife and three children in Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. His oldest child studies at the university and the other two children go to secondary school. His wife is unemployed. 

Batmunh started the business in 1994 and he produces iron-made utensils and other household stuff. It has been successful because there has been a demand among local customers. He also bought a small van with the business income and when the sales are low, he runs a taxi business sometimes. These have been the only financial resources for the family members. 

Batmunh is a good-natured man who says, "I would like to develop my business activities by buying the materials wholesale so that I can save more and produce more at one time." The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy necessary materials.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials wholesale for his blacksmith work.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old.  He is from Naivasha and is married.

Joseph is a farmer and has been in farming activity for the past 12 years. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings, and pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 35 years old.  He is from Nakuru and is married.  He has three children who are in school.

Julius has a business of extracting stones to sell to his customers, which he has been doing for the past 14 years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET ltd., to enable him buy another piece of land that will help him extract more stones.

He hopes to own a quarry in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al cuidado de sus hijos,ella es profesora cesante,la socia quiere salir adelante y que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de universidad de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to devote herself to caring for her children.  She is a retired teacher.  She wants to get ahead, and she wants her children to finish their education.

The member is requesting the loan to make the monthly university payments for her children.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to make the monthly university payments for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 30 years old and married with one child. For the past eight years, he has sold spare motor vehicle parts to earn a living and has employed one person. Benard describes his business environment as favorable because he has limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve  his living standard.

Benard is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy spare motor vehicle parts to sell. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy spare motor vehicle parts to sell

loans.name: Lhagvajav

texts.en:
Lhagvajav is a 27-year-old woman who lives with her mother and a son in the Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. Her son goes to the local kindergarten and her mother is a retiree. Lhagvajav has completed training as a hairdresser and she used to work as an assistant. Now, she rents a seat at a salon and has been running a successful business. Lhagvajav has a number of regular customers in the area and her income has significantly improved her family's household. Lhagvajav is a smart woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activity by buying the necessary tools for the business." 

Lhagvajav is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to buy necessary salon tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy salon tools and equipment

loans.name: Enebish

texts.en:
Enebish is a 53-year-old man who lives with his wife and a daughter in Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. His daughter is 28 years old and his wife is employed. He started a beauty supply business in 2010 after he retired. When his daughter graduated as a pharmacist, he started a pharmacy business, too. He brings the supplies and his daughter stays at the shop counter and works as a shop assistant. 

Enebish is a hardworking and pleasant man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the goods wholesale so that I could save on transportation expenses and spend it on the right needs." The total amount he is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy the beauty supplies in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies in large quantities

loans.name: Srey Oun

texts.en:
Srey Oun is aged 32, married and no children yet. She lives with her husband in a village located in the Kang Meas district of Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through farming every three months, pig raising for four months at a time, and supplement their income through fishing and supplying music for weddings once a month. They have been in this business for eight years. With the current sources of income, Srey Oun can earn up to US$6 per day but can save only around US$1.50 each day. 

This is Srey Oun's second loan with VisionFund, Kiva's field partner. Lacking money for her house renovation, she is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 Khmer riels. She will use the entire loan to buy wooden timbers and zinc for her house renovation. She hopes that this loan will enable her and her family to have a decent, clean house to live in.

loans.use: To buy wooden timbers and zinc for her house renovation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en: Abdel Karim is a 46-year-old Lebanese man. He is widowed and living on his own. He is doing his best to make a good living. It was a bit hard for him to open his own laundry, but not impossible. He knows every single detail concerning this job, so he opened his own laundry in 2010. Today, he is hoping to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a dryer machine for his business. He notes that this will help increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to earn additional income and improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase a dryer machine for his business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 48-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. They have three children who are all attending school. He is doing his best to earn a superior income and to be able to live well with the cooperation of his wife. 

Mohammad has owned an accessories and gifts shop since 1994. Today, he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products for his shop such as accessories, gifts, and many other items. He notes that this Kiva loan will increase his sales and help him attract new customers. In the future, he plans to open other branches in different areas.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for his shop such as accessories, gifts, and many other items

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 48-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children are working and the other is still studying. Her husband is the one looking to offer them a good future. Salwa has been working as a tailor since 1995, and she also works as a clothing trader. 

In order to earn higher revenues, she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the necessary products for her business, such as textiles, clothes and many other items. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase textiles, clothes and other items for her business.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 33 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Beniko, sous préfecture de Fana.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures, de poisson, de céréales, du charbon de bois et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                        
La cliente FATOUMATA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang debout, compte acheter un litre d’huile d’arachide, 10kg de tomate et quelques kilos d’oignon avec les revendeurs de Tingolé pour ensuite les vendre sur place au village à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12 500FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of Tiessiri Group are all married. They average 33 years of age and three children, and all live in extended traditional families in the village of Beniko, Fana sub-prefecture.

They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood and friendship. They buy and sell condiments, shoes, fish, cereals, charcoal, and soap. They are seeking their sixth solidarity loan (group loan). 

FATOUMATA, standing and second from the left in the photograph, intends to buy one liter of peanut oil, 10 kg of tomatoes, and a few kg of onions from resellers in Tingolé. She will then sell the products in her village, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 12'500 (ca US$ 25), to be used to cover her family's needs. One part will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy peanut oil, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Buraima

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Buraima obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to expand her herd. Now Buraima has applied for a loan of KGS 100,000 to use for purchasing additional cattle. Revenues from this loan will be used for purchasing materials for her house  building.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans for sale.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 37 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Guegneka. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de chaussures, de poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des chaussures, du poisson et du savon.                                                                                                                                                                                                    
La cliente MARIAM,  deuxième personne à partir de la gauche, compte acheter deux paniers de poisson frais avec les fournisseurs du marché de Fana pour ensuite vendre sur place à la maison à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans l’activité de commerce de poisson.
texts.en:
The women of Yiriwa Group are all married and average 37 years of age and five children. They all live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana,  in the Guegneka neighborhood.

They got acquainted through bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and friendship. They buy and sell condiments, shoes, fish, and soap. They are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan), to be used to buy condiments, shoes, fish, and soap.

MARIAM, second from the left in the photograph, intends to buy two baskets of fresh fish from providers at the market in Fana. She will then resell the fish at her home, to a clientele comprising both women and men.

She foresees turning an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to cover her family's needs. One part will be reinvested in her fish selling business.

loans.use: to buy two baskets of fish

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a 29 year-old retail shop owner in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and the mother of two children, who are in school. She has been a shopkeeper for the past two years. Her business is doing great.

This is her first loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and washing detergents.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 46-year-old man. He lives in Lebanon. He’s married and lives with his wife and four children, three of them are working. He strives to work really hard to be able to offer a suitable life for all of them. Nabil started his own work as a car blacksmith in 1990, and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added mechanic tools for his business. This will facilitate his business operations and allow him attract added people. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase added mechanic tools for his business

loans.name: Fègnon Odette

texts.fr: Agée de 56 ans, Fègnon Odette est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes, pommades, mèches et autres articles. Elle a sa boutique sise à son domicile. Soucieuse d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire afin de satisfaire ses clients, elle bénéficie d'un concours à Finadev. Le revenu supplémentaire dégagé par l'activité lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Fègnon Odette is 56 years old, married, and mother of two children.

She specializes in the sale of loincloths, ointments, hair extentions, and other items. Her shop is located in her home.

Striving to increase her sales in order to satisfy her customers, she is receiving assistance from Finadey. The extra revenue from her business will allow her to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 10 loincloths, 20 cosmetic products, 20 hair extentions, and she will use the rest to buy other items

loans.name: Rachid

texts.fr:
Rachid est un homme âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 2 enfants qui vont à l’école. Le premier a 15 ans et le dernier a 12 ans.
Rachid travaille comme revendeur et nettoyeur depuis 2011. Il vend des cartes de recharge et est propriétaire d’un service de nettoyage pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché.
Rachid a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un aspirateur pour son travail et des cartes de recharge. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Rachid voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit d’assurer le bonheur de sa famille.
texts.en:
Rachid is 38 years old and married to a reseller. He has 2 children who both go to school. The eldest is 15 years old and the youngest 12.

Rachid has been working as a reseller and cleaner since 2011. He sells recharge cards to all types of customers in his store, and also runs a laundry service. He gets his supplies in Lomé and works alone. Right now, his principal challenge is the competition on the market.

Rachid has requested his first loan from WAGES so that he can buy a vacuum cleaner for his job, and some recharge cards. He wants to reinvest in his business.

In years ahead, Rachid would like to increase the size of his business. He plans to use his profits to ensure his family's happiness.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner and some recharge cards.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.fr: Mariée et mère d'un enfant, Prisca fait de bissap, des jus d'anana, de baobab. Expérimentée dans le crédit, elle fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue de satisfaire sa diverse clientèle, et de maximiser son intérêt. Le revenu supplémentaire lui permettra d'assurer l'éducation et la bonne santé de son enfant.
texts.en: Prisca is married and has one child. She makes bissap, as well as pineapple and baobab juice. She is well-versed with loans and has asked Finadev for a loan to satisfy her diverse clientele and maximize her interest. The extra revenue will allow her to assure the education and the health of her child.

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of sugar, 10 flavorings, bissap (hibiscus) leaves, and one small refrigerator

loans.name: Issam

texts.en: Issam is a 33-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and 5 siblings, of which 2 are working. The whole family combines forces in order to live properly and as it should be. As for Issam, he has owned a flower shop since 2000. He has a variety of flowers at fair prices. Today, he's asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to import the needed quantity of flowers from outside the country. He’s sure that this Kiva loan will increase his sales, therefore his profits. In the future, he plans to have his own land where he can cultivate flowers.

loans.use: to import the needed quantity of flowers from outside the country

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 47-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and six children, who are all attending school. He has big responsibilities to care for, especially after being the only one responsible for his family. In 2000, Hussein started his own work as van driver on a free lance basis. He’s a reputable man, it's what make his customers loyal to him. Today, he has the intention to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new van for his business. This new van will allow him to transport more people. In the future, he plans to buy another van and hire someone to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase a new van for his business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 33-year-old married mother of three. She has been running a successful fishmongery business in Mombasa for five years. 

This is Esther's second business loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch and prawns to sell to her customers. 

She hopes to realize more profits from the increased sales and thus be able to expand her business further. The anticipated profits will also be used to buy more stocks of fish and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase more tilapia, Nile perch and prawns to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts, pants, and shorts, etc

loans.name: Norminha Duberlen

texts.es:
Norminha es una mujer peruana que lucha constantemente por sacar adelante a su familia junto a su esposo, el cuál labora como taxista en un carro alquilado. Esta pequeña familia ha tenido que afrontar grandes retos, no solo económicos sino también los desastres naturales que se han presentado en su localidad.

Ella  se dedica a la venta de plásticos a partir de las 8 y 30 de la mañana, es allí donde sus clientes empiezan a frecuentarla, Norminha tiene experiencia en este tipo de negocio desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha aprendido poco a poco a cómo manejar este tipo de negocio. Actualmente ella desea poder comprar fardos de bolsas de plástico, lo que le permitirá comprarlos a un menor precio y así podrá incrementar sus ingresos, ya que es en estos meses donde sus clientes se incrementan, principalmente los escolares, debido a los distintos trabajos educativos que deben realizar.

Con este apoyo que se le está brindando, Norminha desea poder comprar junto a su esposo una moto taxi propio y así poder juntar poco a poco para comprar un local propio.
texts.en:
Norminha is a Peruvian lady who constantly strives with her husband to get her family ahead.  Her husband works as a taxi driver in a leased car.  This small family has had to face great challenges, both financial and natural disasters in the area.

She sells plastic goods beginning at 8:30 in the morning, when her customers begin arriving.  Norminha has been working in this business for two years, and has been gaining experience in managing this type of business little by little.  Now she wants to begin selling packages of plastic bags.  She’s able to buy them at a good price and will be able to increase her income because it’s during these months that her number of customers increases, mainly students, because of the various types of schoolwork they must do.

With this support, Norminha, together with her husband wants to buy a moto taxi of their own and save up, little by little, to buy their own shop.

loans.use: to buy a moto taxi.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel earns a living through his motorcycle transport business. He has been in this business for seven years. He describes his business environment as competitive because many other people are in the same business. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Daniel has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. 

Daniel has applied for 90,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Arafat

texts.en:
Arafat is a 42-year-old Lebanese man who lives with his wife and four children, some of whom are still attending school. 

Since 2005 he has owned a shop which sells electronics and home appliances. 

Arafat is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of new electronics, such as mixers, electric fans, casseroles etc. 

In the future, Arafat plans to add more items to his shop in order to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of new electronics such as mixers, electric fans, casseroles etc.

loans.name: Homagnissi Lucie

texts.fr: Homagnissi Lucie est mariée, âgée de 32 ans et mère de 02 enfants. Elle commercialise des divers. En vue  d'agrandir  son fonds  de commerce  et d'avoir  un grand nombre de profit elle a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Les revenus devraient lui permettre de supporter ses enfants pour les besoins vitaux.
texts.en: Homagnissi Lucie is 32 years old and a married mother of two children. She markets a variety of goods. With the aim of expanding her business capital and having more profit, she is requesting financing from Finadev. The revenues (profit margins) should allow her to meet the essential needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy a box of canned tomatoes, 5 trays of eggs, a box of sardines, a box of spaghetti, 8 liters of oil, and a box of rice (1 kg).

loans.name: Agwenyi

texts.en:
Agwenyi is 50 years old, from Nakuru and is married with three children. He is an estate agent.

Agwenyi has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy paint and window panes to do renovations to his office, and also to pay his workers. He is optimistic that when his office looks better, he will serve his clients well who come looking for houses.

He hopes to expand his business and buy a piece of land in the near future.

loans.use: to buy paint and window panes

loans.name: Luxdi Bernardita

texts.es: Luxdi de 46 años vive  ( PORTOVIEJO Ecuador). Ella deccidio escoger este negocio de tener una tienda para mejorar su situación económica y para ayudar a los vecinos que vallan a comprar tan lejos a parte su esposo vende encebollados por la mañana.  Trabaja todos los días sola . a futuro ella anhela tener bien su negocio y darle una buena vida a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( colas arroz, harinas ect).
texts.en:
Luxdi, 46, lives in Portoviejo, Ecuador.  She decided to choose this business of having a store to improve her financial situation and to help her neighbors who go so far to shop.  She works alone every day.  In addition, her husband sells "encebollados" [fish stew made with onions] in the morning.  In the future she wants to have her business doing well and give her children a good life.

With the loan she will buy soda, rice, flour, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, and beverages.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 41-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and five children, who are still attending school. After losing hope of finding a proper job, he decided to work on his own as a taxi driver one year ago to be able to afford their heavy life expenses.

Today he is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his car so as to carry on with his transportation business safely. In the future, he plans to purchase another car in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his car so as to carry on with his transportation business safely

loans.name: Gloria Moran

texts.es: Gloria de 27 años vive( fortin Guayaquil) . ella decidido  ponerse una tienda en su vivienda porque tubo una baja situación económica por ese motivo ella se puso ese negocio. Aparte ella tiene un mini bazar y le va bien. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo todos los días . a futuro ella desea tener una buena casa. Con el préstamo comprara (arroz cuadernos  etc)
texts.en:
Gloria, 27, lives in Fortín, Guayaquil.  She decided to set up a store in her home because she had a low economic situation.  In addition, she has a small stationery store and it is going well for her.  She works with great effort every day.  In the future she wants to have a good house.

With the loan she will buy rice, notebooks, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and notebooks.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He has owned a barber shop in his town for many years. Due to his loyalty and great customer service, there are a good number of customers visiting his shop. Even though, his income is barely sufficient for him to be able to pay the high costs of living. So, today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his shop and purchase an electrical generator for his business. 

In the future he plans to borrow another Kiva loan with the intention of renovating his shop to attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve his shop and purchase an electrical generator for his business

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a 40-year-old charcoal seller in Mombasa. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been doing this business for the last four years with great success.
 
This is her second business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal to resell to her customers.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business further. She hopes to have a successful business and thus live a happier and comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four. She practices dairy farming in Mariakani and has been selling milk to her customers for the past four years with great success.

This is her second business loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more dairy cattle. She will use the anticipated profits to build herself a residential house. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more dairy cattle

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 22 years old and from Naivasha. She is married to Peter. They have one daughter who is eight years old and in primary school.

Loise has a timber yard that she has been running for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more timber to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a full-fledged timber and hardware store in Naivasha in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more timber

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, age 48, is married and has six children. She has four children still attending school. She also cares for four other family members who are not able to support themselves.

She sells pagne, colorful African fabric, in her shop in a local market. Pagne is mainly used to make clothing, but can also be used for tablecloths, napkins, and curtains. 

Rosalie will use the loan to buy more pagne for her shop. She has operated this business since 1982! She is very experienced in buying and selling pagne, and she has acquired many loyal customers throughout the years. Her strategy is to buy good quality pagne to stock her shop. 

Rosalie has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. She hopes to one day be able to send her children to study abroad. She wishes for her children to be successful and happy.

loans.use: to buy pagne, colorful African fabric

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni es una mujer de 30 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos, ubicada en caserío San Pablo, en el distrito de Tambogrande. Localidad está ubicada en la zona de Cruceta, y aún no cuentan con los servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla la titular es crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral, como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 8 ovinos, 12 pavos y 5 cerdos. La actividad se la reparten entre esposos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente. 
El monto del crédito solicitado es de 500 nuevos soles, los cuales serán utilizados para la compra de alimentos balanceados para sus animales.
texts.en:
Marleni is 30 years old, is in a common-law marriage, and has 4 children.  She lives with her husband and children in their own house, which is located in the hamlet of San Pablo in the Tambogrande district. This area is part of the Cruceta region, which still largely lacks basic services.

Marleni’s main economic activity is raising livestock, including sheep, pigs, and poultry.  She currently has 8 sheep, 12 turkeys, and 5 pigs.  She and her husband support each other by sharing the responsibilities of this activitity.

Marleni is asking for a loan of 500 soles, which she will use to purchase nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase nutritionally balanced feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 33 years old and owns a retail shop in Mombasa. She is married and a mother of three children. She has been a shopkeeper for the past five years. She also sells water and fresh juices to supplement her income. Her business is doing great.

This marks her first borrowing from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents. 

She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business further and to repay her loan. She hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil, and washing detergents

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Aitbubu obtain her two Kiva loans, which were used as intended and repaid. She was able to broaden her herd. Now Aitbubu has applied for a loan of 20,000 KGS to purchase additional cattle. Revenues from this loan will be used to purchase materials for her house reconstruction.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 60 years old and a widow who supports eight people in her family.  She sells fruit and vegetables as part of a business she started eight years ago. 

She has requested a loan of KES 10,000 to purchase potatoes, bananas and vegetables to sell.  The profit she makes will help her build a grocery shop. Her dream is to be a successful business woman.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, bananas and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 53 years old, single, and has five children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 23 years.

This is her second loan KADET LTD. She paid her previous loan well and in good time. She will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow. She hopes to be among the top farmers in her area.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Курбон женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. Жена работает уборщицей. Более 10 лет Курбон занимается купле- продажей сельхозпродуктов. В основном он продает картошку и лук. Курбон хочет создать своей семье уют и комфорт, с этой целью он старается расширить свой бизнес. Курбон хотел бы получить займ для покупки картофеля и лука для пополнения оборотного капитала с целью расширения бизнеса. Курбон надеется на вашу поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Kurbon is married and has five children.  His wife works as a janitor.  Kurbon has been involved in buying and selling agricultural crops for over ten years.  He primarily sells potatoes and onions.  Kurbon wants to provide coziness and comfort for his family and tries to expand his business with this goal in mind.  Kurbon wants to obtain this loan to buy potatoes and onions to refill his working capital in order to expand his business.  Kurbon relies on your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and onions in order to increase his working capital

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es: Carlos  de 45 años vive ( machala ecuador ). El empezó desde muy pequeño a trabajar como oficial de mecánica. Luego hizo un curso aprendió y decidió poner su propio taller de mecánica. El realiza su trabajo con mucho esfuerzo y ganas todos los días solo. A futuro el anhela que su hijo aprenda su profecion y salir adelante . con el préstamo comprara ( herramientas ).
texts.en:
Carlos, 45, lives in Machala, Ecuador. He began to work as a mechanic when he was very young.  Later he took a course and learned, and he decided to install his own vehicle repair shop.  He carries out his job alone with great effort and desire every day.  In the future he wants his son to learn his profession and get ahead.

With the loan he will buy tools.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old. She and her husband Daniel have three children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is Jane's first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings, and part of it to pay school fees.

Jane hopes to see all her children through their education.

loans.use: To purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 33 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Maribeth is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maribeth has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariel

texts.en:
Mariel is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mariel is 26 years old and has one child who is in school.

Mariel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mariel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials for her fishing business.

Mariel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Mariel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 47 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Marina works very hard to provide for them.

Marina runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Marina has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, egg, noodles, etc.

In the future Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is forty-four years old and married with four children.

Mercidita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a plastic-ware retail business in the Philippines and has requested a loan for PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mercidita has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF previously.  She has been running the plastic-ware retail for twelve years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.

Mercidita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.ru: Чумахон трудолюбивый и добросовестный юноша. Он очень активный и более 1, 5 года  занимается купле- продажей запчастей для легковых автомобилей. Данный бизнес приносит ему стабильный доход и за счет своего бизнеса он помогает своим родителям. Чумахон хотел бы получить займ для покупки автозапчастей с целью расширения бизнеса и пополнения оборотного капитала. Чумахон надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Jumakhon is a hardworking and conscientious young man.  He is very active and has been involved in buying and selling spare parts for passenger cars for over 1.5 years.  This business yields a stable income for him, which helps him to help his parents.  Jumakhon wants to obtain this loan to buy spare parts in order to expand his business and refill his working capital.  Jumakhon relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to expand his business

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
37-year-old Cosmas and his wife Esther are blessed with three children ages 10, 8, and 4 years. He sells shoes, a business he has been doing for the past 5 years, and earns a monthly income of 8,500 Kenya shillings (KES). 

He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more shoes for resale. The profit made from his sales will assist him in starting a business for his wife. His dream is to become a prominent businessman in the future. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a dried fish business in the Philippines.  Mylene has been in this business for fifteen years now.

Mylene has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is fifty-five years old and has eight children.  She is married and five of her children are in school.

Ofelia is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ofelia has been farming rice for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is thirty-nine years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Rina works very hard to provide for them.

Rina runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Rina has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, biscuits, eggs, noodles and spices among other things.

In the future Rina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is married with nine children.  She is forty-four years old and has two children who are in school.  She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Rita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

Rita has been in this business for ten years.  In the future, Rita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is twenty-eight years old and married with five children.

Rovelyn works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rovelyn has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before.  She has been running the charcoal retail business for three years and also earns an income from rice retail.

Rovelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcaol to sell.

loans.name: Haydee Bertha

texts.es: Haydee es una mujer emprendedora de 39 años de edad, casada con 02 hijos en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de pescados, la cual lleva trabajando más de 07 años en este negocio. Este negocio surgió, gracias a su hermana, ella fue  quien  la motivo a emprender su propio negocio. Con su trabajo y dedicación a podido apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y con la educación de sus hijos. Haydee tiene como objetivo poner una tienda de abarrotes la cual le permitirá tener mejores ingresos. Con el  crédito que solicito va a comprar pescados y materiales que le solicitan en el instituto de su hija, la cual estudia cosmetología. Haydee agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en: Haydee’s an enterprising, 39 year old woman, married with with two school age children.  She sells fish and has been in this business for 7 years.  The business arose thanks to her sister who motivated her to start a business of her own.  With her work and dedication she’s been able to help her husband cover household expense and pay for their children’s schooling.  Haydee’s objective is to open a grocery store that will produce higher income for her.  With the loan she’s requesting she will buy fish and supplies the institute her daughter attends is requiring; she’s studying cosmetology.  Haydee thanks Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Née vers 1976 à Bamako, Djelika vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite Djelika s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des articles divers : habits, pagnes wax, parures, chaussures, boucles  d’oreille, chaines etc.   
Après avoir correctement remboursé les cinq prêts précédents, Djelika est à son sixième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  10 pièces de pagnes wax, 5 douzaines de  paires de chaussures, 4 douzaine de chaines pour le cou et  3 douzaines de boucles d’oreilles auprès des  grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Djelika espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in Bamako, Djelika lives with her six children and her husband in an extended traditional family in the rural community of Ouelessebougou.
 
Not having had the good fortune to pursue her schooling, Djelika quickly turned to earning income, primarily by buying and selling various items: clothing, "wax" African prints, necklaces, shoes, earrings, chains, etc. 
  
After having correctly reimbursed the five prior loans, Djelika is on her sixth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She will use the loan to buy 10 lengths of African print cloth, 5 dozen pairs of shoes, 4 dozen necklaces and 3 dozen pairs of earrings from wholesalers in Bamako. She  sells retail, for cash or credit, out of her home and in the marketplace of Ouelessebougou to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Djelika hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used to help her husband support the family, to repay the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Juan Romulo

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy luchador, que con mucho esfuerzo saca adelante a sus hijos adelante, con el tiempo ha aprendido a esforzarse cada vez más debido a que es el único sustento que su pequeña familia tiene, debido a que es padre soltero.

Juan ha sufrido mucho tras el abandono de su esposa, pero con el tiempo ha aprendido a fortalecerse y encontrar ese consuelo en sus pequeños, los cuales lo aman y admiran mucho. Cuando Juan terminó de estudiar el colegio deseaba poder estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería pero en vista a que sus padres no tenían los ingresos suficientes para pagar los costos de esta, el decidió buscar otro medio para ganarse la vida, y fue así como su hermano le enseño el negocio del transporte de carga en triciclo.

Juan se despierta todos los días muy temprano con el fin de traer el alimento diario que necesitan su hijos. El ya cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en este negocio y poco a poco ha logrado conocer a mucha gente y que esta necesite de sus servicios. 

Con un poco de ayuda Juan podrá renovar el triciclo que tiene, ya que está algo viejo y necesita unas cuantas reparaciones, a su vez desea poder también remodelar su vivienda ya que así sus hijos se sentirán mucho más seguros en casa. Juan desea esforzarse mucho más, para darle una carrera profesional a su hija y así ella pueda ser una gran persona de éxito.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man who with much effort moves his children forward.  In time he’s learned how to strive harder every time because he’s the only means of support for his small family because he’s a single father.

Juan has suffered much because of his wife’s abandonment but in time has learned how to strengthen himself and find comfort in his little ones who love and admire him very much.  When Juan finished his secondary schooling, he wanted to study engineering but because his parents did not have sufficient resources to pay for it, he decided to find another way to earn a living and this is how his brother taught him the business of transporting cargo in a three-wheel bicycle cart.

Juan awakens very early every day to earn the daily food his children need.  He has five years’ experience in this business and has gradually gotten to know many people who need his services.

With a little bit of help, Juan will be able to renew his three-wheel bicycle cart which is a bit old and needs some repairs and at the same time will be able to do some home repairs so that his children will feel much safer at home.  Juan wants to work even harder to give his daughter a professional career so that she can become a very successful person.

loans.use: to renew his three-wheel cart and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Tita Natividad

texts.es: Tita de 49 años vive  ( fortin Guayaquil ). Ella deccidio escoger este negocio de tener una tienda para mejorar su situación económica.  Aparte tiene una papelería en la cual le va bien.  Trabaja todos los días sola . a futuro ella anhela tener bien su negocio y darle una buena vida a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( colas arroz ect).
texts.en: Tita, 49, lives in Fortín, Guayaquil.  She decided to choose this busienss of having a store to improve her economic situation.  She also has a stationery shop and does well with it.  She works alone every day.  In the future she'd like to have her business well and give a good life to her children.  She will use the loan to buy colas, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 45 years old. He and his wife Jane together have four children. He is a green grocer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his first term loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of cabbages, fruits, and kale for his business.

He hopes to boost his green grocery to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cabbages, fruits, and kale for his business.

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru:
Динаре 46 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. С 1997 года Динара занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 5,000 сом (KGS). В настоящее время в хозяйстве Динары имеется  1 дойная корова, 1 лошадь и 15 овец,  ежемесячная прибыль от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет примерно 9,000 сом (KGS).  В сезон, Динара получает прибыль от продажи фасоли, получаемой с 1,20 га орошаемой земли, также на придомовой территории находится яблоневый сад, приносящий около 80,000 сом (KGS) в год.
