В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Динара обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Dinara is 46 years old, married and has three children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry since 1997, having started this business with an initial amount of 5,000 som (KGS).  At the present time, Dinara's business contains one dairy cow, one horse and fifteen sheep, and the monthly profit from sales of milk and milk products amount to about 9,000 som (KGS).  During the season, Dinara makes a profit from sales of beans, obtained from 1.20 hectares of irrigated land.  She also has an apple orchard by her house, yielding about 80,000 som (KGS) per year.  In order to further develop her business, Dinara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Victor Jesus

texts.es:
Victor es un joven peruano, que tras el terminar el colegio y no tener las posibilidades económicas para poder estudiar la carrera de mecánica, decidió convertirse en un microempresario y así ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. El y su familia han pasado momentos muy duros, pero con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado salir adelante y han aprendido a no darse por vencidos.

Victor se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público, en la pequeña localidad del distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú, diariamente se levanta muy temprano para alquilar la moto taxi que todos los días alquila, debido a que la de su padre se encuentra averiada y ha decidió juntar un poco de dinero para poder arreglarla y tener un mayor sustento.

Victor transporta diariamente a los escolares de la zona, lo que le permite tener un sustento diario. Actualmente el está solicitando apoyo económico para que pueda realizar la reparación de la moto taxi de su padre y pueda conducir allí, ya que le da mucha pena tener en casa un vehículo que le puede servir y resultar mucho más económico. Con esto, Victor desea ahorrar lo que sea necesario para comprarse un vehículo y continuar apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Victor is a young Peruvian who having finished secondary school and having no economic ability to study the career of mechanics decided to become a micro businessman and help his parents with household expenses.  He and his family have gone through very difficult moments but with much effort and dedication have managed to get ahead and have learned not to give up.

Victor provides public transportation service in the small location of Parcone in Ica, Perú.  He rises very early every day to lease the mototaxi he rents daily because his father’s is broken and he’s decided to save a bit of money in order to repair it and earn more income.

Every day Victor transports students in the area which allows him to earn daily earnings.  He’s currently asking for economic support to repair his father’s mototaxi so he can drive it because it causes him much anguish to have a vehicle at home that doesn’t work and could be much more economical for him.  With this, Victor wants to save what’s needed to buy a vehicle and continue helping his family.

loans.use: to repair his father's mototaxi.

loans.name: Isidoro

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de cevicheria que es un plato a base de pescado con limon,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de cevicheria.El socio solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como limon,pescados,cebollas y maiz.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member continues with his ‘cevichería’ [marinated seafood stand] which is a dish made with lemon.  He works from 8am until 5pm and through this business is able to support his children.  His dream is to expand the business.  He’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients to cook like lemon, fish, onions and corn.  He’s happy about the loan and committed to make his installment payments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Benadatte

texts.en:
Benadatte is 43 years old and is married with four children ages 24, 18, 14, and 12 years. She owns a salon, a business she started 15 years ago, and earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

Benadatte has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase hair shampoos, conditioners, weaves, and braids. The anticipated profit will help to pay school fees for her children. She dreams of being a prominent business lady. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase hair shampoos, conditioners, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her sari-sari store.  Rowena has requested to borrow PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy an additional fishing net for her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Melida Sandra

texts.es:
Melida tiene 33 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo de 12 años de edad al cual ama mucho y que por su edad ya le saca canas verdes porque es muy travieso, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Nazca, ciudad conocida por su clima cálido, asimismo en esta ciudad se ubio una  de las culturas pre-incas más importantes de nuestro país que es la grandiosa cultura Nazca, sobre todo porque dejaron como legado uno de los atractivos turístico más importantes del país que son las Líneas de Nazca; son dibujos inmensos ubicados en un extenso campo de tierra árida y que según algunos estudios sirvieron como un calendario astronómico para la cultura Nazca. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho las comidas típicas e nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platillos favoritos es el riquísimo “Seco de Res”.

Cada día Melida sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella se dedica a su negocio alrededor de 13 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 25 clientes en el día, ella cree que le va bien en su negoció porque es muy amable con los clientes y es muy dedicada en su trabajo.

Melida está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio(arroz, azúcar, fideos, enlatados, entre otros), así tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos y seguir adelante para hacer realizad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Melida, 33, lives with her 12-year-old son whom she loves very much and who, because of his age, is driving her to an early grave because he is very mischievous.  Like a good Peruvian, she likes the traditional dishes of our country very much.  One of her favorite dishes is the delicious "Seco de Res" [beef stew].

Her home is located in the city of Nazca, known for its warm climate.  This city also was the site of one of the most important pre-Inca cultures in our country, the magnificent Nazca culture.  They left as their legacy one of the most important tourist attractions in the country, the Nazca Lines, immense drawings in a vast desert.  According to some studies, they served as an astronomical calendar for the Nazca culture. 

Melida goes out every day to work with a lot of enthusiasm in her business selling groceries.  She works at her business around 13 hours a day and serves up to 25 customers in a day.  She believes that it is going well for her in her business because she is very friendly with the customers and very dedicated to her job.

Melida is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (rice, sugar, noodles, and canned goods, among other things).  In this way she will have a greater variety of products to sell to her customers, which will allow her to have greater income and get ahead to make her biggest dream a reality: "To have her own house."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, noodles, and canned goods, among other things).

loans.name: Daciana

texts.es:
Daciana es una mujer que tras la pérdida de su esposo ha luchado mucho por salir adelante sola, sus hijos han sido un gran apoyo moral y ella se siente un poco más acompañada junto a sus nietos, los cuales se han convertido en su mejor razón para continuar.

A Daciana le hubiese gustado dedicarse a trabajar como docente de educación, pero debido a que no contaba con el dinero necesario, decidió desempeñarse en otras labores, todo ese esfuerzo la llevo a poder comprarse un pequeño local, el cual lo está dando en alquiler, lo que le ha permitido generar algunos ingresos.

Gracias al apoyo que se le está brindando desea poder darle el mantenimiento que necesita a su pequeño local, ya que conversó con el que realiza la renta del local y llegaron al acuerdo de cobrar un poco más de lo usual siempre y cuando se arregle. Daciana desea que con este pequeño nuevo ingreso pueda comprar ropa y así vender por ella misma en el local que alquila, de esta manera cumplirá su gran sueño, mudarse a un lugar mucho más seguro.
texts.en:
Daciana is a woman who after the loss of her husband has struggled much to get ahead by herself.  Her children have been of great moral support for her and she feels a bit less alone in the company of her grandchildren who have become her greatest reason to carry on.

Daciana would have liked to be a teacher but because she lacked the necessary money she decided to do other jobs which led to her being able to buy a small locale which she is renting out and which produces some income for her.

Thanks to the support she’s getting she’ll be able to give the small locale the maintenance it needs since she talked to her tenant and they agreed that she’d be able to charge a slightly higher than normal rent as long as she fixes up the space.  Daciana hopes that with this new income she will be able to buy clothes to sell herself in the space she currently rents out thus reaching her great dream of moving to a much safer place.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mesrop

texts.en:
Mesrop is 27 years old. He lives in Getap village with his parents. Mesrop works at the rescue service as a senior sergeant. Besides the work, Mesrop is also involved in agriculture. He breeds a cow and keeps 5 beehives.

Mesrop has applied for this loan to develop his beekeeping business. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 15 beehives. The increased number of beehives will allow Mesrop to gather more income from honey sales.

Mesrop plans to start his own family, and he dreams of ensuring a high quality of life for them. Development of the farm will provide the necessary means for him to implement his goals.

loans.use: to pay for beehives.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1980 à Ouelessebougou, Fatoumata vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame dans le quartier N’tentou de la ville de Ouelessebougou. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer dans les études,  très vite Fatoumata s’est  intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente des habits en provenance du Maroc et des pagnes wax de Lomé (au Togo).    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre prêts précédents, Fatoumata est à son cinquième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 pièces de pagnes wax  auprès des  grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya et Tièlé)  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1980 in Ouelessebougou, Fatoumata lives with her four children and her husband in a monogamous family in the N’tentou district of the town of Ouelessebougou. 

Since she did not have the good fortune to pursue her studies, Fatoumata quickly became interested in income-earning activities, especially buying and selling clothing coming from Morocco and "wax" African print cloth from Lomé (Togo).   
 
After having correctly reimbursed her first four loans, Fatoumata is on her fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She will use it to buy 100 lengths of "wax" print cloth from wholesalers. She sells retail, for cash or credit, out of her home and in the marketplace of Ouelessebougou and in the big bi-weekly markets nearby (Sido, Sélingué, Keleya and Tièlé)  to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Fatoumata hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which will be used to help her husband support their family, to reimburse the loan, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Fabio De Jesus

texts.es:
Fabio es una persona que ha tenido que superar muchas adversidades en su vida, las cuales gracias a su amor por el trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante ha podido remediar y seguir progresando junto a su familia. Fabio se encuentra casado y tiene 6 hijos de quienes manifiesta son su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su trabajo todos los días. Anteriormente Fabio se desempeñaba como agricultor, actividad que se vio en la obligación de dejar a un lado dadas las pocas oportunidades que se iban presentando al llegar una gran empresa a su región que acabó con el resto de los cultivos. Fue así como aprendió por medio de un familiar a fabricar colchones y posteriormente abrió un local en el centro de su municipio donde fabrica los colchones y los vende junto con camas y mesas de noche. En este negocio le ha ido muy bien, pues rápidamente lo aprendió a trabajar y se ganó el aprecio de sus clientes, sin embargo, hace aproximadamente 2 años tuvo que superar una de las mayores adversidades que se le han presentado en la vida; su fábrica de colchones se incendió dejando todo el local quemado y ningún bien material dentro del local pudo ser recuperado, además, una hija de 5 años murió en esta tragedia. Sin embargo, la fortaleza de Fabio le permitió salir adelante y reiniciar con su fábrica de colchones, la cual sigue teniendo actualmente y en la cual sigue ofreciendo muy buenos productos a sus clientes. Gracias a sus buenas ventas, Fabio busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de materias primas para la fabricación de los colchones y la compra de camas y mesas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

Fabio espera seguir respondiendo a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes y seguir progresando en su negocio junto a su esposa y sus 6 hijos. Además, Fabio tiene el sueño de tener un local propio para no tener que seguir pagando los altos costos del arriendo que hacen que sus ganancias se reduzcan considerablemente.
texts.en:
Fabio is a person who has had to overcome much adversity in his life, which thanks to his love of work and desire to succeed, he has been able to deal with and keep progressing together with his family.

Fabio is married and has six children. He says that his children are his motivation for working hard every day. Previously, Fabio worked as a farmer, a livelihood he was obliged to set aside, given the few opportunities that were presenting themselves, with the arrival in the region of a large company that did away with the rest of the farms. 

So, through a family member, he learned to make mattresses, and subsequently opened a shop in the center of the municipality, where he makes the mattresses, and sells them together with beds and night tables. Things have gone very well for him in this business, as he learned the work quickly, and earned the appreciation of his customers.

However, approximately two years ago he had to overcome one of the greatest adversities that has arisen in his life. His mattress factory burned down, leaving the entire shop burned, and no good material inside the shop could be recovered. In addition a 5-year-old daughter died in this tragedy. However, Fabio's fortitude allowed him to move forward and restart his mattress factory, which he still has at the present time, and where he continues offering very good products to his customers. 

Thanks to his good sales, Fabio is seeking a loan that will offer him the chance to purchase raw materials for making the mattresses, and buying beds and tables to offer to his customers.

Fabio hopes to continue responding to customer orders and keep progressing in his business together with his wife and six children. In addition, Fabio's dream is to have his own shop, and not have to continue paying the high rental costs that reduce his earnings considerably.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making mattresses, and to buy beds and tables to offer his customers.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo is 53 years old and divorced, and lives in the Cayambe region of Ecuador. He lives alone and has no kids.

Gustavo describes himself as someone who never gives up, so when he found himself suddenly unemployed about 7 years ago, he quickly turned to cattle raising and sales in order to make a living. He now owns some cows and pigs and hopes that this loan, his first, will help him increase his numbers in order to raise his revenue. 

Gustavo's hopes for the future include owning a farm where his cattle can graze and where he can peacefully live out his life.

loans.use: To buy livestock such as pigs and cows.

loans.name: Sucett

texts.en:
Sucett is twenty-nine years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Sucett has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before requesting this loan.  She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Sucett aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1965, Fatoumata vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une  famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Ouelessebougou. 
Fatoumata s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa tante qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Fatoumata, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour l’achat vente de céréales : arachide, niébé, mil, fonio, maïs, dah etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les trois prêts précédents, Fatoumata est à son quatrième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  100 sacs de mil, auprès des paysans producteurs (à Diako, Tiélé et Bancouman) et quelques rare fois avec les  grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de consommateurs. 
Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born around 1965, Fatoumata lives with her six children and her husband in an extended traditional family in the rural community of Ouelessebougou. 

Fatoumata became interested in income-generating activities at an early age, working with her aunt who sold a bit of this and that. After her years of experience with her aunt, Fatoumata decided to sell cereals: peanuts, "niébé" (cowpeas) , millet, "fonio" (a kind of millet), maize, hibiscus flowers, etc. 

After having correctly reimbursed her three preceding loans, Fatoumata is on her fourth loan with Soro Yiriwaso. She will use it to buy 100 sacks of millet from the farmers who produce it  (in Diako, Tiélé and Bancouman) and on rare occasions from local wholesalers. She sells her merchandise retail, for cash or credit, at the marketplace of Ouelessebougou and at the big bi-weekly fairs in the area, to a clientele composed essentially of consumers. 

Fatoumata hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA which she will use to help her husband support the family, to reimburse the loan, and to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru: Аличон трудолюбивый и добрый человек, он женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Жена занимается домохозяйством. Более 6 лет Аличон занимается купле- продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он откармливает и ухаживает за скотом дома, а также имеет хорошие условия для их содержания. Аличон хотел бы получить займ на покупку автомашины для перевозки скота. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Alijon is a hardworking and kind person.  He is married and has two children.  His wife is involved in household work.  Alijon has been involved in buying and selling cattle for over six years.  He fattens up and cares for livestock at home and also has good conditions for keeping livestock there.  Alijon wants to obtain this loan to buy a car in order to transport livestock.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies and raw materials for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 52 years old and married with eight children.

Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Susana has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Susana aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. Jenelyn is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Carmelita is 59 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Carmelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is thirty-nine years old and married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more wood to sell.

Clarisa has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF previously.  She has been running the firewood retail business for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling pigs.

Clarisa aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more wood to sell.

loans.name: Ines Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Inés  tiene 46 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 19 y 25 años. La Sra. Inés se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y  productos de belleza ella entrega a distintos lugares oficinas y domicilios donde le hacen pedidos,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Inés utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de camisas y chompas ya que esta empezando con la venta de ropa a la par de la venta de cosméticos, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo, la Sra. Inés  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son clientes que tardan en cancelar los productos y esto dificulta ya que no puede generar mas ingresos,  Ella va a utilizar los beneficios del crédito para mejorar su casa, la Sra. Inés es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Ines is 46 years old, married, and has 2 children aged 19 and 25.  She has a business selling cosmetics and beauty products that she delivers to various offices and homes where she takes her orders.  This will be her second loan with this institution.  Ines will use this loan to buy shirts and sweaters, because she is starting another business selling clothing in addition to her business selling cosmetics.  The reason that she requested this loan is to increase her working capital.  Ines faces challenges in her business, including the customers who are late in paying for their products, and this makes it hard for her to generate more income.  Ines will use the profits from this loan to make some improvements to her house.  Ines is a very hardworking person who is happy to be getting this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy shirts and sweaters

loans.name: Isabel Micaela

texts.es: Isabel de 54 años vive ( paraíso Guayaquil ). Ella desde pequeña le gusto el comercio . isabel es muy buena para ofrecer haci que decidió entrar a la venta de perfumes y bisutería .es casada tiene un hijo su esposo es chofer . trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas sola . a futuro ella anhela tener una grand red de mercadeo .con el préstamo comprara ( mercadería perfumes ).
texts.en: Isabel, 54, lives in the Paraiso neighborhood of Guayaquil.  Ever since she was small she has enjoyed selling and she is good at it, so she decided to start selling perfumes and accessories.  She is married and has one child, and her husband works as a driver.  She works every day on her own, and she puts a lot of effort into it.  In the future, she hopes to have a big marketing network.  With this loan, she will purchase merchandise, including perfumes.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and creams

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a business, selling vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years now and also earns additional income from selling rice.

Luna has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Luna would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Karina Patricia

texts.es:
Karina es una mujer que ha enfrentado muchísimos retos y momentos penosos, lamentablemente ella perdió a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el fatídico terremoto del año 2007 que azotó toda el distrito de Santiago, Ica, Perú, con el tiempo ha logrado aprender a superar y emprender una nueva vida.

Actualmente ella tiene una pequeña bodega, la cual abrió después de su penosa perdida, ella le puso como nombre las iníciales de sus familias con el fin de tenerlos siempre presentes. Karina comentó que se animó a abrir este pequeño negocio con el fin de dedicarse a algo y no se sumergiera en los tristes recuerdos que tenía.

Ella tiene muchos clientes, los cuales le han tomado cariño gracias a su trato amable. Con un poco de apoyo ella desea poder ampliar un poco más negocio y así iniciar la venta de cuadernos, lapiceros, folders, productos descartables, etc. ella desea incrementar sus ingresos de esta manera y así poco a poco tener una librería un poco más equipada, donde sus clientes se sientan cómodos y encuentren todo lo que necesitan. Con mucho esfuerzo, constancia y dedicación desea poder terminar de construir su vivienda para sentirse más segura en ella.
texts.en:
Karina is a woman who has faced many challenges and difficult times.  Sadly, she lost her husband and her two children in the fateful earthquake of 2007.  It ravaged the entire Santiago district in Ica, Perú.

In time she has managed to learn, to pull through, and to begin a new life.  She currently has a small general store, which she opened after her terrible loss.  She used her family members’ initials as the name of the store so that she would always have her family present.

Karina says that she cheered up as she opened this small business.  She did this in order to devote herself to something and not submerge herself in the sad memories that she had.  She has a lot of customers, and they have taken a liking to her thanks to her kind treatment.

With a little support she wishes to be able to expand her business a bit more.  This way she would start selling notebooks, pens, folders, and disposable products, etc.  She wishes to increase her income this way, and she wishes to gradually have a better equipped shop.  Then her customers will be more comfortable, and they will find everything they need.

With a lot of effort, perseverance, and dedication she hopes to be able to finish building her house in order to feel more secure in it.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, folders, and disposable products, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family.  Gloria is married and has a business, buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Gloria has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.  Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business, selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell for her business.  Leonora has been in this business for 25 years.  Leonora earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old.  She is married and has two children who both attend school.  She is also a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marilyn has a business, selling fish in the Philippines.  Marilyn has requested a loan in the amount of 24,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more fish to stock and sell.  Marilyn has been in this business for 12 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to stock and sell.

loans.name: Neneth

texts.en:
Neneth is 40 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   

Neneth is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Neneth has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (general) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cayambe Girls Group

texts.en:
Daysi, the girl pictured wearing the black sweater, is a 22-year-old single mother of two kids, a boy and a girl.  She lives in the Cayambe region of Ecuador and describes herself as a quiet and hardworking mother who always tries her best to provide for her family.  

About two years ago she began buying and raising guinea pigs (called "cuys" in Ecuador). She has been doing well so far with this business, but hopes that with this, her first loan, Daysi and her partners will be able to increase their income in order to expand their small businesses and better provide for their loved ones. 

Daysi and her group partners, Maria Fanny and Mireya, are pictured. Also pictured is Daysi's brother, who is not part of the group.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs to sell.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.ru: Чамила умная и честная девушка, ей 21 года. Она студентка 3-го курса Худжандского Университета. Она учиться на факультете «Иностранных языков» по специальности английский язык. На равне с отличной учебой, Чамила активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Является делегатом Молодежного Парламента Республики Таджикистан, секретарем Студенческого Совета Университета, а также получает стипендию Председателя Области. В будущем хочет стать преподавателем английского языка. Чамила хотела бы получить займ для оплаты обучения в университете. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Jamila is a smart and honest young woman, who is 21 years old.  She is a third-year student of the Khujand University.  She studies in the Foreign Languages department, specializing in English.  Along with her excellent study, Jamila actively participates in the university's public life.  She is a delegate of the Youth Parliament of the Tajikistan Republic, secretary of the University's Student Union and also earns a stipend as the Region's Representative.  In the future, she wants to become an English language teacher.  Jamila wants to obtain this loan to pay for her university education.  She relies on your help and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge, the man in the striped shirt standing in the middle of the picture, is 21 years old and single, and has no children.  He lives in the Cayambe region of Ecuador and describes himself as friendly, open, and respectful.  

About a year ago, Jorge and his brother decided to open up an Internet cafe in his hometown. The business has since been doing pretty well.  He wishes to take out a loan for the first time in order to expand his shop and buy more computer equipment in order to better serve his growing clientele.  If Jorge's income increases, and with the help of his brother, he is determined to go to college and study civil engineering, although he hopes to also keep this business going for a long time.

loans.use: to buy more computer equipment for his Internet cafe.

loans.name: Grupo De Juana Group

texts.en:
Juana, the lady in blue, is 48 years old, married, and mother to a 16-year-old girl.  She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

She began her business about twenty years ago, when her husband lost his job and was having a tough time finding another one.  Juana now works with her daughter and her two friends, Maria Isabel and Johana, raising and selling pigs.  Juana hopes that this loan will help her expand her business by allowing her to buy more pigs and sell them at a faster rate.  

She hopes that in the future she can save enough money to buy a plot of land on which to establish a pig farm, something which would further stabilize her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es: Mariana de 43 años vive ( isla Guayaquil  ) . ella decidió junto a su esposo vender plásticos y poner un local de bebidas . le va bien en ese negocio . trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo y hijo mayor .a futuro ella anhela incrementar su local . con el préstamo comprara ( bebidas, dulces, plasticos, enlatados)
texts.en:
Mariana is 43 years old, and she lives in Isla Guayaquil.  She decided, together with her husband, to sell plastics and to set up a place for drinks.  It is going well for her in this business.  

She works with the help of her husband and her oldest child.  In the future she wishes to expand her place.  

She will use the loan to buy drinks, candy, plastics, and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy drinks, candy, plastics, and canned goods.

loans.name: Angela Fausta

texts.es: Angela de 54 años  vive (playa villamil ) ella decidió entrar al negocio de venta de ropa por motivo de que su esposo murió. Ella necesitaba tener ingresos económicos para sus hijos. Haci que decidió por tener un bazar .salió adelante y ahora se dedica a su bazar .sus hijos ya son mayores e independientes. Trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y ganas todos los días con la ayuda de su hija su dificultad es la delincuencia . a futuro ella anhela tener su negocio grande y mejorar su salud con la ayuda de DIOS. Con el préstamo comprara (ropa utiles ect ).
texts.en:
Angela is 54, and lives in Playa Villamil. She decided to go into the retail clothing business because her husband died, and she needed to have income for her children. So she decided to have an assorted goods shop.  She succeeded, and now works in her shop. 

Her children are now adults and independent. With her daughter's help, she works with a great deal of effort and enthusiasm every day. The challenge she has is crime. In the future, she wants very much to have a large store, and to improve her health with God's help. With the loan she will buy clothing and school supplies.

loans.use: To buy clothing and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Maria Félix

texts.es:
La señora Maria Félix solicita el préstamo para arreglar su local que le esta haciendo falta algunas reparaciones y pintar el local, también necesita comprar material para la inversión en el negocio de preparación y venta de alimentos mexicanos.
Doña Maria Félix se dedica desde hace aproximadamente dos años, en el comercio de elaboración y venta de alimentos, su esposo trabaja en una fábrica y por las tardes le ayuda atender el negocio. Con estos dos ingresos han sacado adelante a sus dos hijos de edad escolar. 
Desean invertir en este negocio y después invertir para un negocio de abarrotes y así tener mas ingreso a la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Félix is applying for the loan to fix up her stand, which needs some repairs and paint. She also needs to buy ingredients for her business preparing and selling Mexican foods.

For approximately two years, Maria Félix has been in the business of making and selling Mexican foods. Her husband works in a factory, and in the afternoons helps her run the business. With these two incomes, they have raised their two school-age children. They wish to invest in this business, and later invest in a grocery store, and this way have more family income.

loans.use: To repair and paint her stand, and buy materials for her food business.

loans.name: Zoyla Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila de 44 años vive ( machala  Ecuador ). Ella decidió vender mariscos ´por el motivo de que su esposo la dejo con sus hijos . ella necesitaba sacar adelante a su familia y decidió entrar a la venta de mariscos .  su dificultad es  la delincuencia. trabaja todos los días sola. A futuro ella anhela mejorar su negocio y salir adelante . con el préstamo comprara (mariscos como camaron, pescados ).
texts.en:
Zoyla, 44, lives in Machala, Ecuador.  She decided to sell shellfish because her husband left her with her children.  She needed to get her family ahead and she decided to go into selling shellfish.  Her problem is crime.  She works alone every day.  In the future she wants to improve her business and get ahead.

With the loan she will buy fish and shellfish such as shrimp.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr:
Née vers 1981 à Bamako, Rokia vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille monogame  dans le quartier  mission catholique de  Ouelessebougou ville. 
Rokia n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa  grande sœur qui faisait le commerce d’articles divers. Rokia, après des années d’expériences  avec cette dernière, opta pour  les mêmes activités à savoir le commerce d’articles divers : produits de beauté, produits alimentaires, des parures, etc.    
Après avoir correctement remboursé les deux prêts précédents, Rokia est à son troisième  prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs de attièkè, 3 cartons de broches à dents et pour les cheveux,  3 carton de pâtes dentifrices et 2 carton de bleu (pour les habits). Elle s’approvisionne avec les  grossistes de la place et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans le marché de Ouelessebougou et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle mixte. 
Rokia espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in Bamako, Rokia lives with her four children and spouse in a monogamous family in the catholic mission neighborhood of Ouelessebougou.  Rokia has not had the opportunity to advance her education, as she became very quickly interested in income-generating activities, taking after her older sister who had been doing business trading miscellaneous articles.  

Rokia, after years of experience in this business, opted to pursue the same activity selling various products: i.e. beauty, food, ornamental products, etc.

After having properly repaid her two previous loans, Rokia is on her third loan through Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to purchase 20 sacks of attiéké [dish prepared from cassava], 3 cartons of tooth- and hairbrushes, 3 cartons of toothpaste and 2 cartons of blue ([dye] for garments).  She buys her stock from wholesalers in the area, and makes  sales in cash and credit, as well as online from her home and in the market of Ouelessebougou, among others in the area, to a mixed clientele.

Rokia hopes to earn a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA, which she will use to aide her husband in providing for the family, to pay back her loan, as well as reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to purchase various products.

loans.name: Louella

texts.en:
Louella is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and two of her children are in school.

Louella has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more stock like shampoo and snack foods to sell in her general store.

Louella has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock like shampoo and snack foods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 69 years old and married with seven children.

Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, canned goods, and other groceries.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 50 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Merlinda aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, biscuits, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Fusena

texts.en: For the last 15 years, Fusena has been selling watermelon and oranges in Ayensudo, near Elmina. This married mother of three children uses her income to help support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Fusena is now requesting a loan to buy watermelon and oranges to sell, and will use the resulting additional profits to expand her business

loans.use: to buy watermelon and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market, fries it, and sells it in Ayensudo near Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband works with a transport company. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to  purchase fresh fish to fry and sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Asibe

texts.en: Asibe sells cooked rice. She serves it with macaroni, meat and fish stew in Ayensudo near Elmina. Asibe has been selling cooked rice for the past twelve years now. She is divorced and has three children. Asibe uses her income to feed and clothe her children. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, meat and fish. Asibe will use her new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, meat and fish to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace cooks rice and fish stew which she sells in Ayesudo near Elmina. Grace is divorced and has three children. She has been in this business for some years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit, Grace plans to build a better stall where she can sell her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish and other ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a baker. She bakes bread which she sells in Ayensudo near Elmina. She is married and has three children. Mary has been baking for twenty-five years now. She uses her income to support her husband to feed and clothe their children. She will use her loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar and  cooking oil for her bakery. She hopes to expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar and cooking oil for her bakery.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda sells watermelons and oranges in Ayensudo near Elmina. She has done this for five years now. She is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Linda will use her loan to buy watermelons and oranges to sell. With the new profits she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy watermelons and oranges to sell.

loans.name: Hassana

texts.en: Married to a teacher and the mother of three children, Hassana lives in Ayensudo near Elmiina  where she owns a cosmetics shop selling body and hair creams. She uses her income to assist her husband in maintaining their family. Hassana is requesting this loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell, and will use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a fruit-vendor. She sells peas and watermelons in Ayensudo near Elmina. She has been doing this for five years. She is married to a driver and has four children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their children's school fees. Mariama will use her loan to purchase variety of fruit to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a fruits vendor. She sells pineapples and watermelon in Ayensudo near Elmina. She has done this for five years. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their children’s school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase variety of fruit to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es: Juan de 48 años vive ( quevedo ecuador ). El comenzó vendiendo pescado en bicicleta . ahora cono le ha ido bien lo hace en su moto o en su carro. El trabaja todos los días solo con esfuerzo y con ganas de salir adelante . a futuro el anhela tener su casa propia y darle una buen a vida a sus hijos. Con el préstamo comprara ( pescado, platanos ect )
texts.en:
Juan is 48 years old, and he lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He started selling fish from a bicycle.  Now, as it has gone well for him, he makes his sales from his motorcycle or his car.

He works alone every day.  He works hard, and he has a great desire to get ahead.

In the future he wishes to have his own home and to give his children a good life.

He will use the loan to buy fish and bananas, etc.

loans.use: to buy fish and bananas.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita operates an agricultural chemicals shop in Ayensudo near Elmina. She is married with three children, and her husband is a farmer. She has been in this business for three years now. She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe their children. Anita will use her loan to purchase more agricultural chemicals to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more agricultural chemicals to sell.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua produces palm oil to sell. She has been into this business for ten years now. She lives together with her husband, who is a farmer, and three children. Ekua uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility bills. Ekua will use her loan to purchase palm fruit to produce the oil to sell. With the new profit, she wants to buy a machine for the production of her oil.

loans.use: to purchase palm fruit to produce oil to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is fifty-four years old and is a married woman with four children aged between fourteen and twenty-nine. She is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Marina also sells food items like pancakes, rice cakes and banana cue (deep fried bananas) to her community. She works hard to send her children to school.

Marina has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar, flour and cooking oil. This will help increase Marina's business profitability. She plans to use any extra profit to pay for school expenses and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and ingredients such as sugar, flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Apolinar

texts.en: Apolinar,s a married man with five children, is a farmer working in San Miguel, Bohol. He has been growing and selling rice for more than 10 years, working hard to keep his farm productive in order to provide for his family. Now requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs, Apolinar  hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda, a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol, is 48 years old, married, and has nine children, four of whom are already adults. Belinda, who grows rice crops both  for family consumption and selling, is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. She is happy that this loan will help her fund her farm, and hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Edison Javier

texts.es: Edison de 25  años vive ( quevedo ecuador ). El decidió entrar al oficio de ser taxista porque quería independisarce . el fue chofer y ahora es taxista  la dificultad que el tiene es la competencia de taxis.  El trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y ganas todos los días solo . a futuro el anhela comprara vehículos y abministrarlo . Con el préstamo comprara (herramientas, llantas, bateria).
texts.en:
Edison is 25 years old, and he lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He decided to enter into the taxi business because he wanted to become independent.  He was a chauffeur, but he is now a taxi driver.  

The difficulty that he has is the taxi competition.  He works alone every day with great effort and will.

In the future he longs to buy vehicles and to manage them.

He will use the loan to buy tools, tires, and a battery.

loans.use: to buy tools, tires, and a battery.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is divorced and has four children. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their bills.

Aba cooks banku, which she serves with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce at Agensudo near Elmina. She has done this for three years. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to build a stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish for preparing banku to sell.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en: Armando is thirty-seven years old and is a married man with three young children aged three, six and seven. Armando has had a refrigeration business for six years. He also delivers Globe Telecom's bills to earn an extra income. Armando works hard to sustain his family and save for his children's education. He requested this loan to purchase tools and other spare parts. Armando hopes to succeed in his endeavors.

loans.use: to purchase tools and other spare parts.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is thirty years old and is a married woman with four children aged between three and ten. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Cecile is a seaweed farmer. She earns 2,000 PHP per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to purchase seaweed, straw and wooden pegs. This will help Cecile's business profitability. Cecile plans to use any extra income to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed, straw and wooden pegs.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a forty-four-year-old married woman with three children aged thirteen, eighteen and twenty-two. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Corazon has had her sari-sari store business for ten years. She sells items like canned goods, milk and snacks. Corazon also sells fresh fish to her community. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP with her businesses. She has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and dried fish. Corazon hopes to be able to sustain her children's education through her business activities.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and dried fish.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en: Sixty-three-year-old Daniela is a married woman with two children aged twenty-three and twenty-eight. Her husband works as a farmer. Daniela is also a farmer and has been growing rice for 25 years. She works hard to keep their farm productive and their family healthy. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Daniela hopes to be rich in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo siguen en la actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Carina tiene 32 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo que trabaja de albañil, ellos tiene 4 hijos varones el mayor estudia en el CBTA (bachillerato) y los tres pequeños están en la primaria, ella solicito su prestamos para comprar obleas y recortarlas en diferentes tamaños, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años por necesidades económicas; al inicio le dieron a recortar obleas y fue comprando obleas para trabajar por su cuenta, su negocio es importante porque así ayuda económicamente a su esposo. 
Lo que mas le gusta de este negocio es que trabaja en su casa y puede atender a sus hijos, su esposo y su hijo el mayor le ayudan a pegar en paquetitos las obleas, ella se siente orgullosa de poder ayudar a su familia para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. 
Uno de los desafio que enfrenta es la competencia ya que varias personas es su comunidad tienen el mismo negocio.
Carina utiliza las ganancias para la comida, y los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener crianza de becerros, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a poder comprarles a sus hijos el vestuario para los bailables de la escuela. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con sus préstamos nos ayudan a surtir los negocios y seguir trabajando”.
texts.en:
The members of the group continue in the work they carry out.  Carina, 32, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband, who works as a bricklayer.  They have four male children.  The oldest studies in the CBTA [Centro de Bachillerato Tecnológico Agropecuario] (secondary school), and the three younger ones are in elementary school.

She requested the loan to buy "obleas" [a sweet made from two thin wafers filled with caramel] to cut into different sizes.  She started her business four years ago because of financial need.  In the beginning they had her cut obleas, and she bought obleas to work on her own.  Her business is important because in this way she helps her husband economically.  What she likes most about this business is that she works at home and can take care of her children.  Her husband and her oldest son help her put the obleas in little packets.

She is proud to be able to help her family with her children's school expenses.  One of the challenges she faces is competition because several people in her community have the same business.  Carina uses the profits for food and her children's school expenses.  Her dreams and hopes are to raise calves.

She is happy about this loan she is going to receive.  She is going to be able to buy her children the wardrobe they need for the dances at school.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad, "Thank you for supporting us with your loans.  They help us stock our businesses and continue working."

loans.use: to buy "obleas" [a type of sweet] to cut.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is fifty-three years old, married and has eleven children, six of whom are still school-aged. Dionesia's husband is also a farmer.

Dionesia primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month doing this farming. She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Dionesia plans to use any extra income to pay school expenses and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is fifty-seven years old and is a married woman with a nineteen-year-old child. She has had a sari-sari store business for ten years. She sells soft drinks, bread, vinegar, soy sauce and other various items. Guillerma earns about 3,000 PHP per month from her store.

Guillerma is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, salt, sugar and canned goods. She hopes to earn more and be able to sustain her child's education.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, salt, sugar and canned goods.

loans.name: Los Cedros Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Los Cedros, está conformado por la señora Justina va a comprar con su préstamo cuadernos, lápices, colores, plastilinas, resistol, cartulinas, la señora Ever va a comprar lencería, blusas, pantalón de vestir, el señor Mario va a comprar placas de sitio para su taxi, la señora Elizabeth, va a comprar abono y fertilizante, la señora Rosalinda va a comprar hilos telas, pinturas, agujas. La señora Rosalinda tiene 43 años de edad, ella es casada su esposo es taxista, ella tiene 8 hijos  6 mujeres y 2 varones, solo estudian  3 mujeres dos en la secundaria y una en la primaria y un varón en bachilleres, ella vende servilletas bordadas y pintadas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilos, telas, pinturas, agujas para tener material para bordar y pintar las servilletas una parte del préstamo para la comida, ella inicio su negocia hace 25 años, con un retazo de tela que le regalaron lo corto, lo bordo y las vendió con eso fue comprando su material ahora ya tiene sus pedidos en su casa, su negocio es importante porque es una ayuda económica que beneficia a su familia. Sus sueños y esperanzas son tener un local donde venda sus productos y que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “muchas gracias por prestarnos, les deseamos muchas bendiciones y que nos sigan apoyando con su préstamos para crecer los negocios”.

loans.use: To buy thread, fabric, paint, and needles for embroidering serving cloths.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en: Ignacia is a married woman with six children between the ages of 14 and 27. Her husband is a farmer. Ignacia also works as a farmer. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops. According to Ignacia, she earns 9,000 PHP per month doing this farming. She requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. Ignacia hopes for her family's standard of living to improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is thirty-two years old and is a married woman with four children aged four, six, eight and twelve. Irene's husband is a fisherman.

Irene has been a seaweed farmer for seven years. She earns about 5,000 PHP per month from seaweed farming. She also supports her husband's fishing and helps him sell his catch at the market. Irene has requested a loan to purchase straw, seaweed and gasoline for the fishing boat. Irene hopes that through her loan, her business will prosper.

loans.use: to purchase straw, seaweed and gasoline for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Las Magnificas esta compuesta por 3 integrantes todas mujeres, La coordinadora del grupo es la Sra. Carmen tiene 27 años y es soltera con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de 10 años, La Sra. Carmen se dedica a la venta de  VDV Y VCD´S  de manera ambulante, esta es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Carmen utilizara  este préstamo   para comprar DVD y VCD¨s por cantidad para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar inventario, la Sra.  Carmen enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el mercado. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios del crédito para tener  puesto de venta propio, se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The "Las Magnificas" group is made up of three members, all of whom are women.  The coordinator of the group is Señora Carmen, who is 27 years old.  She is single with one child, who is ten years old.  

Señora Carmen works selling DVDs and CDs as a street vendor.  This is her first time working with the lending institution.  Carmen will use this loan to purchase a quantity of DVDs and CDs so that she can provide a variety of products for sale to her her customers.  The reason she is requesting this loan is to increase her inventory.  Señora Carmen faces challenges in her business, namely the large amount of competition in the market.  She will use the proceeds from the loan to have her own sales stall.

She is happy about the opportunity that's being provided to her and to her companions in the group.

loans.use: to purchase more DVDs and CDs.

loans.name: Hajba

texts.en:
Hajba is a forty-two year old, smiling, kind mother of five. She is a married Iraqi woman who has been using her sewing skills for thirteen years, working from home on various custom orders. Hajba takes pride in meeting the demands of the household, taking care of the children and contributing to the family's income. 

In the past Hajba successfully applied, received and repaid a Relief International - Iraq Microfinance loan, which she used to purchase an iron, some tools and raw materials to improve her sewing business. 

Today Hajba took a new loan in the amount of 1,800 USD to improve her work area by purchasing some small furniture items and to also purchase fabric and other raw materials.

loans.use: to improve her work area and to purchase fabric and other raw materials.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is photographed in her office in the training center she has.

Suha is a 37-year-old woman. She is married with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is employed with a salary not enough to cover all the family's costs and needs.

For the past two years, Suha has been opening a training center to enhance students' skills in using computers and other related topics, which has been a profitable project.

Suha is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing computers to use for training purposes. This will enable Suha to have more students in the center, which will increase number of training courses the center holds and improve Suha's income positively.

loans.use: To purchase computers for the training center she has.

loans.name: Rothella

texts.en:
Rothella works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood retail business in the Philippines.

Rothella requested a loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy firewood and resell it to customers. She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from raffia crafting.

In the future, Rothella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to resell to customers.

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is photographed while she is sewing clothes.

Mayson is a 38-year-old single woman. For the past 12 years, Mayson has been sewing and selling clothes to customers, which has been a profitable project and makes her familiar among customers.

Mayson is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing a new additional sewing machine as she has a lot of requests from customers. This will enable Mayson to meet the demands of customers on time and improve her only source of income for the better.

loans.use: To complete purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Atallah

texts.en:
Atallah is photographed in his restaurant.

Atallah is a 52-year-old man. He is married and a father with three sons and four daughters; one of his sons is working with him in the restaurant.

For the past 8 years, Atallah has been running this food restaurant, which is well known among customers and located in the middle of the refugee camp where he lives. This is the only source of income to the family and a profitable project to Atallah and his family.

Atallah is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing the necessary food supplies he needs to make basic meals such as meat, vegetables, and bread and also to improve the restaurant's condition such as purchasing additional chairs and tables and painting. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase necessary food supplies and improve the restaurant's condition

loans.name: Madelin

texts.en:
Madelin is 29 years old and married, with two children who are in school.

Madelin is in the agricultural business raising hogs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and piglets. She has been raising hogs for 4 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Madelin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets.

loans.name: Belgica Ninfa

texts.es: Belgica de 53 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil ). Ella decidió entrar al negocio de la venta de almuerzos de apoco porque quería mejorar su situación económica . y de esa manera sacar adelante as u familia . sus vecinos le pedían que haga almuerzos especiales y lo hace . aparte ella vende merienda por las noches . atrabaja todos los días con ganas. A futuro ella anhela tener su vivienda . con el préstamo comprara (arroz, carnes, granos).
texts.en:
Belgica is 53, and lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil. She decided little by little to enter the business of selling lunches, because she wanted to improve her financial situation, and that way help her family get ahead in life.  

Her neighbors were asking her to make special lunches and she does so.  She also sells snacks in the evenings. She works every day willingly. Her great desire for the future is to have a house. With the loan she will buy rice, meats and grains.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, and grains.

loans.name: Braulia

texts.en:
Braulia is a 49-year-old widow who raises chickens and sells food and beverages from her front door. Additionally, she has a transportation service in which she rents a car to drivers who take passengers between Urcos and Cusco. On Sundays, from 7 to 10 a.m., Braulia sells food, such as chicken soup, pork adobo soup, and chicken stew. From Monday to Saturday from 9 a.m. to about 3 p.m., Braulia sells chicha (a local beverage) made from quinoa. Braulia also sells food at a livestock fair which takes place on the first Wednesday of each month. She lives with two of her children. One of them works and the other, who is 18, is finishing high school. Her oldest child has a family and lives independently. 

Braulia is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, which she will raise and later sell. Her dream is to open a large restaurant that serves a wide variety of dishes.

Braulia is a member of the village bank "Los Amistosas" in Urcos, which is receiving its fifth loan from Asociación Arariwa. Urcos is located about one hour outside of Cusco in the Andean mountains of Peru.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es: Marivel tiene 35 años de edad y es parte del grupo Nueva Vida, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque gracias a los créditos ellas pensaron que su vida iba a cambiar ya que los créditos les ayudan a todos ellos a mejorar sus negocios y asi  sus condiciones de vida. Mary como de cariño le dicen se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas de maíz a mano, dice que tiene con este negocio aproximadamente más de 4 años y dice que comenzó el negocio para aportar algo a su casa y ayudar a su esposo con la educación de sus hijos, ella está casada con  José Juan  y tienen dos niñas una estudiante de primaria y la menor estudiante de preescolar. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de maíz, cal, leña, sal, papel para envolver las tortillas. Dice que a diario hace dos veces al día por las mañanas empieza hacer a las 8 de la mañana para el almuerzo y en la tarde a las 12 para la hora de la comida, dice que sus clientes son gente de su localidad y vende sus tortillas en su casa donde tiene un puesto con su comal donde hace las tortillas. Dice que le gusta mucho lo que hace porque  la gente le dice que hace muy bonitas las tortillas y muy sabrosas. La meta de Mary es poder contratar una muchacha para que le ayude a elaborar las tortillas ya que abeces le hacen pedidos muy grandes de tortilla y más que nada cuando hay eventos en su comunidad como fiestas. Ella dice que gracias a los créditos que ha recibido por parte de la financiera ella ha crecido como comerciante ya que empezó hacer pocas tortillas y ahora le hace pedidos grandes. Los otros integrantes de su grupo se llaman Juana, Roció, Antonia, Alejandro, América, Magali, María Catalina, Noemí y María Lorena los cuales invertirán sus créditos en una tienda de abarrotes, elaboración de tortillas, venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada, cría y venta de pollos, en una lechería, en un colectivo para servicio público, cosméticos por catalogo, colchas y sabanas, insumos para hacer tamales, venta de ropa para dama, y dulces para su venta.
texts.en:
Marivel is 35 years old and belongs to the group Nueva Vida. She says they gave their group that name (New Life in English) because thanks to the loans they felt their lives would change. The loans have helped them all to improve their businesses and therefore their life conditions.
Mary, as she is known familiarly, prepares hand made corn tortillas. She says she has been in this business approximately over four years and that she started the business to contribute to her home and help her husband with their children's education. She is married to José Juan and they have two daughters, one is in elementary school and the youngest is in preeschool. 
She is requesting a loan to purchase corn, lime, firewood, salt, and paper to wrap the tortillas. She says she makes them twice daily. In the mornings she starts making them at 8 am for for lunch and in the afternoon at 12 for dinner time. She says her customers are locals, and she sells her tortillas at home, where she has a stand with her comal, where she makes the tortillas. She says she really enjoys what she does because people tell her she makes very pretty and very tasty tortillas. 
Mary's goal is to be able to hire a girl to help her prepare the tortillas, since sometimes she gets very large orders of tortillas, especially when there are events in her community such as parties. She says that, thanks to the loans she has received through the finance company, she has grown as a business woman, because she started out making few tortillas and now she gets large orders.
The other members in her group are Juana, Roció, Antonia, Alejandro, América, Magali, María Catalina, Noemí y María Lorena. They will invest their loans in a grocery store, making tortillas, selling seasonal fruit and legumes, raising and selling chickens, in a dairy, in a public service group, catalogue cosmetics, quilts and sheets, staples to make tamales, selling women's clothing, and selling sweets.

loans.use: to make hand made tortillas: she will buy corn, lime, firewood, etc.

loans.name: El Durazno Group

texts.es: las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Imelda va a comprar con su préstamo insecticida y  abono para su huerta de aguacate, la señora catalina va a comprar cuadernos, lápices, cartulina, crayolas, la señora Adriana va a comprar catálogos de temporada, zapatos y huaraches, el resto de las integrantes siguen en su actividad que vienen desarrollando. La señora Catalina tiene 55 años de edad ella es viuda, ella tiene 7 hijos, 6 varones mayores de edad ya trabajan, y una mujer de 17 años estudia el CBTA, ella vende artesanías gabanes, rebosos, mañanitas, artículos de papelería y frutas durazno, peras, ciruela, flores y borregos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar hilo de lana, cartulinas, cuadernos, lápices, lapiceros, gomas, sacapuntas, plastilinas, colores, papel china. Ella inicio su negocio hace 22 años por necesidad buscando la manera de salir adelante con sus hijos, ella aprendió a elaborar los rebozos y los gabanes de su mama. Su negocio es importante porque obtiene ingresos para ayudar a su hija en los gastos de la escuela y le sirve de distracción,  ella le gusta todo lo que hace en la tarde atiende la papelería, 1 día de la semana vende las flores y 2 días en la mañana elabora los rebozos, a ella le gusta elaborar los rebosos y los gabanes ver que están terminados, ella se siente orgullosa de haber ganado un concurso con un rebozo que ella hizo, este negocio es popular por las artesanías indígenas. Sus sueños y esperanzas son crecer su papelería tener todos los servicio de copiadora y engargolado y ver que sus hijos sean personas con responsabilidad y no les falte nada. Ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir va a ampliar su papelería. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les agradecemos sus préstamos, nos ayudan a tener bien surtidos los negocios y a vivir mejor con la familia”.
texts.en:
The new group members are Imelda who will use the loan to buy insecticide and manure for her avocado orchard; Catalina who will buy notebooks, pencils, construction paper and Crayola crayons and Adriana who will buy seasonal catalogues, shoes and huaraches.  The rest of the members continue with the activities they’ve been carrying out.

Catalina is 55 years old and a widow; she has seven children, six adult boys who are all employed and a 17 year old girl who is studying at the CBTA [Farming and Animal Husbandry Technical High School].  She sells crafts like ponchos, shawls, knitted capes, paper goods and fruit like peaches, pears, plums and flowers and sheep.  

She asked for her loan to buy wool yarn, construction paper, notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners, modeling clay, colored pencils and crepe paper.  She started her business 22 years ago needing to find a way to get ahead with her children.  

She learned how to make shawls and ponchos from her mother.  Her business is important because she obtains income that helps with her daughter’s school costs and because it keeps her occupied.  

She likes everything she does; in the afternoons she tends to her stationery shop.  One day a week she sells flowers and two days a week she makes the shawls.  She likes to make the shawls and ponchos and see them finished.  She feels proud to have won a contest with one of the shawls she made.  This is a popular business because of the indigenous crafts.

Her dreams and hopes are to make her stationery shop grow and to have services like photocopying and spiral binding and to see that her children become responsible people and that they don’t lack anything.  She is happy with the loan she’s going to receive because she is going to expand the stationery shop.

The group members want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad:  “We thank you for your loans; you help us keep our businesses well-stocked and to live better with our families.”

loans.use: to buy wool yarn, construction paper, notebooks, pencils, mechanical pencils, erasers, pencil sharpeners. modeling clay, colored pencils, crepe paper.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Cecilia tiene 34 años no es casada pero es madre soltera  con 2 hijos  que son de las edades de 5 y 8 años, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace ya 2 años su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio en la zona de la  mutualista,  Este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución y utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para  construir galpón para el negocio ya que como es época de lluvia no le permite vender por el hecho de que por la lluvia no puede vender sus platillos,  la razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de brindar mejor atención a su clientela, La Sra. Cecilia  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir creciendo, Se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Cecilia, 34, isn’t married but is a single mother of two children who are 5 and 8 years old.  She’s been selling food for the last two years; her business is located in her house which is in the La Mutualista neighborhood.  This loan is her fourth cycle in the institution and she will use this loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a stand for her business because during the rainy season she’s unable to sell because the rain keeps her from being able to sell her dishes.  The reason for requesting the loan is to offer better service to her customers.  Cecilia faces the challenge of continuing to grow in her business.  She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy manure, plant cuttings, soil and pots to grow poinsettias to sell.

loans.name: El Atardecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo “El Atardecer” está conformado por 9 mujeres y un hombre todos son personas muy responsables y trabajadoras.
Doña Angélica es una integrante del grupo atardecer ella tiene 32 años de edad por el momento vive en unión libre con el señor David quien trabaja  de albañil juntos han procreado 4 niños los cuales  de ellos 3 estudian en primaria y el más pequeño de cuatro años aun no está estudiando.
