Christina is 30 years old and still single. Since she is single, she has made her own rule to help her parents in improving their way of living.

She started running her variety store in 2007. Since then, she has been joyously doing her daily routines in order to make a living. Christina is glad because her patience and sacrifices made her a better entrepreneur. By now, she would like to increase the volumes of her merchandise due to immediately sold out items and because she would like to minimize her expensive fare expenses in going to and from the market. In this situation, she needs more capital to buy merchandise. So, she is asking for a loan in the amount of P10,000. She hopes that this loan would be really helpful in achieving her goals in life to further provide for her family needs and make her business more productive.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Hero's Group

texts.en:
Hero is a young Iraqi wife. At the age of 28, she is a mother of three children and to contribute to the family's income she has been using her sewing skills for the past 5 years to work on her family's clothing needs and also on custom orders. 

From a small corner in her home, she makes dresses and other fabric household items, while also taking care of the children and her household. 

Hero took a small loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq in order to purchase an over machine (overlock sewing machine) and some nice fabric and raw materials to be able to provide more choices and a better service to her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an over machine and some nice fabric and raw materials

loans.name: Kototala Group

texts.fr:
Composé majoritairement de veuves, d’une mariée et d’une célibataire, les 4 membres du groupe  KOTOTALA  vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente de savon, de la restauration et la vente d’habits pour femmes et enfants. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Madame, Oumou (assise) est l’une des vendeuses d’habits du groupe. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 douzaines de complets pour enfants auprès des grossistes de Kolondièba. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Oumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The KOTOTALA group is made up of four women, two of whom are widows, one is married and one is single.  They average 33 years of age, 4 children each, and they live in polygamous families.  They all live in the Kolondièba Cercle and know each other because they are neighbors or relatives, or have become relatives through marriage.  They buy and sell soap, clothes for women and children, and also serve meals.

The members of the group have joined Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their business, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Oumou, the woman sitting in the picture, is one of the group members who sells clothes.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 2 dozen outfits for children from wholesalers in Kolondièba.  She resells her merchandise for cash or on credit to a customer base made up of men and women.

With this loan, Oumou is hoping to make average monthly profits of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in the activity and also used to meet some of her family's needs at home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sigija Group

texts.fr:
Composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe  SIGIJA  vivent dans des familles polygames  avec en moyenne 47 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le cercle de Kolondièba et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font l’achat et la vente des articles divers  tels les céréales, les pagnes, les condiments alimentaires etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er prêt solidaire.
Chata,  qui est la femme assise, est la présidente du groupe, elle fait l’achat  vente de céréales et des condiments alimentaires. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 colis de différentes sortes de condiments alimentaires et 2 sacs de céréales auprès des revendeurs du marché de Kolondièba. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame Chata   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge  certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Composed exclusively of married women, the four members of the group SIGIJA live in polygamous families, and they average 47 years of age and six children each. The women all live in Kolondièba Cercle and know one another through ties of community, kinship, and marriage. They buy and sell a variety of goods, such as grains, <i>pagnes<i/> (colorful cloth of western Africa), condiments, etc.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

Chata, who is the woman seated in the photo, is the group's president. She buys and sells grains and condiments. 

She intends to use her loan to buy 2 packets of different kinds of condiments and 2 sacks of grain from retailers of the Kolondièba market. The sales are made in cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Chata hopes to make an average monthly profit 21,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting certain household needs.

loans.use: to buy food supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores a su cargo. Vive en casa propia, ubicada en el caserío Yencala León Uno, en la zona rural de la provincia de Lambayeque. Cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, y su comunidad es de aproximadamente 200 familias.
La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la comercialización  de animales, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años situado en su domicilio, aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.   
El monto del crédito es de 1000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán destinados invertir en compra de animales de engorde para aumentar su inventario, en este caso desea comprar cerdos para su engorde y posterior comercialización.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 26 year-old married woman with two young children. She lives in her own house, located in the hamlet of Yencala León Uno, in the rural zone of Lambayeque province. She has electricity and water service and her community is made up of approximately 200 families.

Yolanda's economic activity is selling animals. She has been doing this work from her home for five years. She learned from her parents, which is to say she knows the work perfectly.

The amount she is requesting is 1,000 nuevos soles, which she will invest in the purchase of animals to increase her inventory. In this instance, she wants to buy pigs to fatten and later sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell

loans.name: Arouna

texts.fr:
Né vers 1976 à Fakola, Arouna vit avec ses 4 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec  d’autres parents, à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Monsieur Arouna s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des animaux (bœufs, chèvres, moutons etc.)  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé les quatre précédents prêts, Arouna est à son cinquième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 2 bœufs et 30 moutons dans les villages environnants. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans les foires voisines à une clientèle composée essentiellement de bouchers et d’éleveurs. 
Arouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
Arouna ambitionne de construire une maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Born around 1976 in Fakola, Mr. Arouna lives with his four children and wife in a large traditional extended family with other relatives, in Fakola. Not having had the chance to go to school, Mr. Arouna soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of animals (steers, goats, sheep, etc.) He is highly valued and in demand in and around Fakola. 

After having correctly repaid the four previous loans, Arouna is now on his fifth loan that will be used for buying 2 steers and 30 sheep from villages. He makes his sales in cash or on credit in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire and at the neighboring fairs. The customer base is composed essentially of butchers and livestock farmers. 

Arouna hopes to make a monthly profit of 125,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in the business. His ambition is to build a house in which to live.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Boubacar

texts.fr:
Né vers 1978 à Léna, Boubacar vit avec ses 2 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Monsieur Boubacar s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des articles divers de boutique  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Boubacar est à son deuxième  prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, deux gros colis composés de cartons de lait en poudre, des biscuits, de conserves,  de concentrée de tomates, de chewing gum, de thé et  de sucre. Il s’approvisionne auprès des revendeurs de Fakola et effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail, dans les foires  de Fakola et Farako à une clientèle mixte. 
Boubacar espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Boubacar was born in Léna sometimes around 1978.  He now lives with his wife and two children in a large extended traditional family in the rural commune of Fakola.  Boubacar did not have the opportunity to attend school, but he soon got interested in income-generating activities, such as small retail business.  He is very popular and very much sought after in Fakola and its surroundings.

Boubacar is on to his second loan which will be used to purchase two large boxes containing cartons of powdered milk, biscuits, canned food, tomato paste, chewing gum, tea and sugar.  He buys his goods from resellers in Fakola and resells them for retail and cash, at the Fakola and Farako fairs, to customers of both genders.

Boubacar is hoping to make monthly profits of 40,000 CFA francs which will be used to provide for his family, pay his loan back, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy various grocery items for retail.

loans.name: Boubacr

texts.fr:
Né vers 1972, Boubacar vit avec son enfant et sa femme dans une famille monogame, à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons religieuses, Monsieur Boubacar s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des noix des produits de cueillette tels l’anacardium etc.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 8 années d’expériences dans le domaine, Boubacar dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt. 
Boubacar compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 3 tonnes de noix d’anacardium auprès des planteurs et femmes des villages. Il effectue ses ventes, au comptant en détail et quelques fois en gros, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans la foire  de Fakola à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes.
Boubacar espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1972, Mr. Boubacar lives with his child and wife in a monogamous family in Fakola. Not having had the chance to go to school due to religious reasons, Mr. Boubacar soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially the buying and selling of nuts that are gathered, such as cashews, etc. He is much appreciated and in demand in the Fakola area. 

Privileged with eight years of experience in this domain, Boubacar, in his search for extra financial resources, decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan. He intends to use his loan to buy 3 tonnes of cashews from planters and women from the villages. He makes his sales retail in cash or on credit, and sometimes wholesale, in the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire and at the Fakola fair. The customer base is composed essentially of retailers from big cities.

Boubacar hopes to make a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cashew nuts

loans.name: Karine

texts.ru:
Более 11 лет Карине занимается торговлей одежды и обуви в небольшом арендуемом павильоне на ярмарке в городе Капане. Муж Карине арендует небольшое ателье, где он принимает частные заказы по переделке одежды, а также шьет одежду, которую Карине продает в своем павильоне.    
Раз в месяц Карине ездит за готовой одеждой и обувью в Ереван. Также она привозит оттуда материалы и другие необходимые товары для бизнеса своего мужа. 
Карине поделилась, что у нее много постоянных покупателей и, что одежда, сшитая ее мужем пользуется большим спросом у ее покупателей. 
Карине и ее муж работают без выходных и благодаря своим занятиям они содержат семью.
Карине 53 года  и у нее двое взрослых сыновей, которые уже замужем и проживают отдельно от родителей. Карине окончила Капанское медицинское училище, где она получила специальность медсестры. 
Карине необходим кредит на сумму 600.000 драм для покупки весенней одежды и обуви для продажи, а также необходимых материалов для ателье своего мужа. Сшитую мужем одежду Карине также намеревается продать в своем павильоне. 
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Карине от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en:
Karine has been selling clothing and shoes in a small rented pavilion at the fair in the town of Kapan for more than eleven years. Karine's husband rents out a small tailoring shop where he does custom tailoring jobs for others and also sews clothing which Karine sells in her pavilion.

Karine travels for ready to wear clothing and shoes to Yerevan once a month. She also brings in fabrics and other necessary goods for her husband's business. 

Karine shared that she has many regular customers and that clothing made by her husband is very popular among her clientele. Karine and her husband work without days off and because of their businesses they are able to support their family.

Karine is 53 years old and she has two adult sons who are married and live separately. Karine has graduated form the Kapan medical college where she got a degree in nursing. 

Karine needs a loan for an amount of 600,000 dram to buy seasonal spring clothing and shoes for sale and also necessary fabrics for her husband's tailoring shop. She plans to sell the clothing made by her husband in her pavilion.

This loan is the third consecutive loan which Karine has received from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to buy spring seasonal clothes to resell and also fabrics for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Brehima

texts.fr:
Né vers 1965, BREHIMA vit avec ses 4 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur BREHIMA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la préparation et vente de pain., c'est-à-dire faire le boulanger.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 26 années d’expériences dans le domaine, BREHIMA dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décide de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  premier prêt
BREHIMA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 tonnes de farine de blé auprès des commerçants grossistes venant de la république de Côte d’Ivoire. Il prépare son pain  et effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit, dans la foire de Fakola  et environs, à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
BREHIMA espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1965, Mr. BREHIMA lives with his four children and wife in a large traditional extended family in Fakola. Not having had the chance to advance in his studies due to societal reasons, Mr. BREHIMA soon became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially making and selling bread, that is, the bakery trade. He is much appreciated and in demand in the Fakola area.

Priviledged with 26 years of experience in this domain, BREHIMA, in his search for extra financial resources, decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first loan. 

BREHIMA intends to use his loan to buy 5 tonnes of wheat flour from wholesale merchants from the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire. He makes his bread and sells it retail for cash, and sometimes on credit, at the Fakola fair and nearby. The customer base is diverse and varied. 

BREHIMA hopes to make a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used to meet family needs, repay the loan, and reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Sharvanbu

texts.ru:
Шарванбу 52 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей. С 1995 года Шарванбу занимается животноводством и земледелием. Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, в настоящее время в хозяйстве Шарванбу имеется  6 овец,  а также земля с хлопком и кукурузой, приносящие в сезон до 40,000 сом.    
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Шарванбу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота и семян хлопка.  Доходы от кредита Шарванбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Sharvanbu is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 1995.  Through hard work and perseverance, Sharvanbu now has a farming business which consists of six sheep and some land on which she grows cotton and corn.  Her business brings up to 40,000 som per season.
Eager to further develop her business, Sharvanbu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS), which will be used to purchase livestock and cotton seeds.  She is planning to invest her profits from this loan into further expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and livestock .

loans.name: Johana Mercedes

texts.es: Johana Mercedes es una emprendedora que se le ha apoyado en el financiamiento para invierta en su negocio en la compra de mercadería y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes variedad de productos, durante los créditos que se les brindo a la emprendedora ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y triunfadora que tiene objetivos que seguir para superarse. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar mercadería lo cual comprara pantalones, camisas, blúmer, short, zapatos, variedad de cosméticos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Johana Mercedes is an entrepreneur who has received previous loans that she invested in her business, buying merchandise so she could offer her customers a variety of products. During her past loans, she has shown herself to be a responsible and successful person with ongoing goals to improve. She is currently requesting financing to buy merchandise like pants, shirts, knickers, shorts, shoes, and a variety of cosmetics, among other products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like pants, shirts, knickers, shorts, shoes, and a variety of cosmetics, among other products

loans.name: Hugo Julian

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo tiene 52 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 25 y 31 años,   el Sr. Hugo es artesano en miniaturas de plomo,  se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastantes años, su taller se  encuentra en su mismo domicilio,  este préstamo es la quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Hugo utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de plomo para realizar sus artesanías la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es para incremento de capital, el Sr. Hugo utilizara los beneficios del crédito para  mejorar su casa, el Sr Hugo es un artesano muy hábil realiza hermosas artesanías que se muestran y venden en las distintas ferias, incluso son vendidas en el exterior, es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo  realiza trabajo de muy buena calidad, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Hugo is 52 years old, married, and has two children who are 25 and 31 years old. Hugo is an artist who makes miniature figurines from lead. He has been doing this work for many years and his workshop is located in his home. This loan is his fifth with Emprender. Hugo will use this loan to increase his capital and to buy lead for making his crafts. Hugo will use the benefits of this loan to make improvements to his house.

Hugo is a very skilled artist who makes beautiful crafts that he displays and sells at various markets. They are even sold abroad. He is a man who is very dedicated to his work and whose products are of a high quality. He feels happy and grateful for the support being offered to him.

loans.use: to buy lead for making figurines

loans.name: Bnar's Group

texts.en:
Bnar is a 27-year-old young Iraqi wife. Together with her husband, she is building the foundations for a nice family, and has been working as a seamstress and tailor for the past 6 years.

In the past, Bnar successfully applied, received and repaid a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, which she used to purchase a new sewing machine, a small furniture item to improve her work area, and fabric. 

Now, Bnar has taken a new loan to further improve her work opportunities. She would like to purchase an overlock sewing machine as well as some additional nice quality fabrics and raw materials to provide a better service for her customers.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients, and each client is evaluated based on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to purchase an overlock sewing machine and nice quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Lupe  Marcia

texts.es: Lupe de 49 años vive ( duran Ecuador ). Ella escogió este negocio de ponerse una tienda por motivo de que se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijas que estaban pequeñas en ese tiempo. Ahora sus hijas están grandes y le ha ido bien en la tienda que aparte se a puesto a vender mercadería. Trabaja todos los días con mucho esfuerzo y ganas sola . con el prestamo comprara ( perfumes, cremas, cosmeticos).
texts.en:
49-year-old Lupe lives in Duran, Ecuador. She decided to set up a store because she needed to raise her daughters who were small at the time. Now, her daughters have grown up and Lupe has done well in her business selling merchandise. 

Lupe works very hard every day and works alone. With this loan, she will purchase merchandise such as perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.use: perfumes, creams and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe está conformado por 12 socias, quienes son amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido, laboran en diferentes actividades en especial en la agricultura, cría de animales y comercio, estos trabajos les permiten ayudar y solventar los gastos de sus hogares para salir adelante con sus familias. Viven por la parroquia  Cumbe que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, en su entorno se encuentran  grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas y haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones que no desentonan  con la belleza del lugar y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gastronomía es muy variada y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Teresa, tiene 50 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 5 hijos, tres de sus hijos son casados y viven  independientes, una hija estudia en el colegio y un hijo pasa en casa. Su esposo labora en el extranjero ha emigrado en busca de trabajo para mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña María Teresa se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y tambien cría gallinas, cuyes, cerdos y ganado a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. Trabaja en la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 7 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cerdos y cuyes para continuar con el negocio. 

Su meta es agrandar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Cumbe communal bank consists 12 members who are kind, gentle and with very warm hearts. They work in various businesses, particularly agriculture, animal husbandry and trade. Their work enables them to help cover the costs of their homes and coping with their families. They live in the parish of Cumbe, south of the city of Cuenca. In this area there are large grazing ranches, farms, and both old and modern buildings which are in tune with the beauty of the place and give more variety to the landscape. The cuisine is varied and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Maria Teresa, 50, who is married and has 5 children as a result of this marriage. Three of her sons are married and live independently, one daughter is studying at school and the other son lives at home. Her husband works abroad. He migrated for work to improve the family's economy. The house she lives in is their own property.

Maria Teresa looks after her household and also raises chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle to sell when she has financial needs. She works in agriculture and her produce is only for home consumption.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 7 years, and the new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, pigs and guinea pigs to continue her business.

Maria Teresa's goal is to expand her business much more.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and cattle

loans.name: Elba Esperanza

texts.es: Elba de 40 años vive ( Quevedo ecuador ).ella tenia un buen trabajo pero por la situación de la enfermedad del papa tuvo que salir para poder cuidarlo . al ver que se estaba quedando en una mala situación económica decidió entrar a las ventas de cartera de cueros .ella las hace sola y le da tiempo de cuidar a su padre . trabaja sola es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de seis meses de nacido, a futuro ella anhela que su psdre este con vida y mejorar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( plantillas, cuero, hilos).
texts.en: Elba is 40 years old and lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She had a good job but because of her father's health situation, she had to leave her job to take care of him. Finding herself in a bad economic situation, she decided to start selling leather purses. She does this on her own and it leaves time for her to care for her father. She is a single mother with one six-month old son. In the future, she longs for her father to still be alive and to improve her business. She will buy patterns, leather, and thread with this loan.

loans.use: to buy patterns, leather, and thread

loans.name: Santa  Ismelda

texts.es: Santa de 37 años vive ( guasmo Guayaquil ) ella decidio entrar al negocio de venta de ropa por el motivo de que su esposo la abandono con sus hijos . ella necesitaba sacar adelante a sus hijos poe ese motivo vende ropa. L a dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia. Trabaja con muchas ganas y fuerza todos los días junto a su hijo menor. A futuro ella anhela tener un puesto grande en la bahía . con el préstamo comprara ( pantalones blusas ect ).
texts.en:
Santa, 37, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil. She decided to set up a business selling clothes because her husband abandoned her and their children. She needed to raise her children and therefore sells clothes. The difficulty she has is crime. Santa works with great gusto and strength every day, with her youngest son.

In the future she longs for a big premises in the bay. With this loan, Santa will purchase pants, blouses etc.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shorts, blouses

loans.name: Yenny Alexandra

texts.es: Jenny de 28 años  vive ( guasmo Guayaquil ). Ella decido trabajar en algo para poder sustentar su vida económica. Comenzó con una pequeña tienda luego decidió vender Yambal y hacer recargas electrónicas . es soltera trabaja todos los días sola. la dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . pero con mucho esfuerzo y ganas sale a trabajar todos los días . a fyruro ella anhela tener una familia y salir adelante . con el préstamo comprara ( perfumes, cosmeticos).
texts.en:
Yenny, 28, lives in Guasmo, Guayaquil. She decided to work on something in order to sustain herself economically. She started with a small shop and then decided to sell Yanbal products and offer electronic mobile top-ups. 

Yenny is single and works every day. Her main difficulty is the crime, but with hard work and desire she goes to work every day. In the future she longs to have a family and succeed in life. With this loan, Yenny will purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Xavier Marcos

texts.es: Xavier de 32 años vive ( playa villamil ). El empezó hace 10 años con este negocio sus estudios fueron electricidad . y eso le ayudo para que ahora se ponga su propio taller . lo logro se desempeña en su trabajo de electricista . es casado tiene hijos su esposa vende cosméticos . trabaja todos los días con esfuerzo y ganas .a futuro el anhela tener su negocio grande. La dificultad que tiene es la delincuencia . con el préstamo comprara ( herramientas, materiales).
texts.en:
Xavier is 32 years old and lives at Villamil Beach.  He started this business 10 years ago.  He studied to be an electrician, which helped him to obtain his own workshop.  He achieved this and carries out the role of electrician.  

He is married with children and his wife sells cosmetics.  He works hard everyday with great effort. In the future he longs to make his business large.  He has difficulty with delinquency.  With the loan he will buy tools and materials.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials.

loans.name: Nancy Clementina

texts.es:
La Señora. Nancy es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la belleza de su Centro Histórico, tiene una gran riqueza natural, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Nancy tiene 39 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 20, 17, 14 y 11 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una Universidad de la ciudad, sus dos hijos siguientes hijos estudian en el colegio y su último hijo estudia en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el extranjero, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Nancy se dedica a la preparación de banquetes para fiestas, actividad que la realiza abajo pedido desde hace 10 años. También tiene un local de cabinas telefónicas e internet, trabaja en esta actividad hace 5 años y de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 9 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de dulces como: chicles, caramelos, chocolates, chupetes, etc. para vender  en su local.
 
Su mayor sueño sería  no tener deudas.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "La Paz" ["The Peace"] Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which has been a World Heritage Site since December 1999, thanks to its beautiful Historic Center. The city has great natural beauty and is crossed by four rivers. Its residents maintain the culture and tradition of their people.

Nancy is 39 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage, who are 20, 17, 14, and 11 years old. Her oldest daughter studies at a university in the city, her next two children are in high school, and her youngest son studies at a little school in the city. Her husband works abroad. She does not have her own house so she rents.

Nancy prepares banquet dinners for parties, and she has been doing so for ten years. She also has a call center with telephone booths and Internet. She has been running the call center for five years, from Monday to Saturday without fixed hours.

She has been a member of her communal bank for nine years and this is her ninth loan. She will invest it in the purchase of sweets like gum, candies, chocolates, lollipops, etc. to sell at her call center.

Her greatest dream is to not have any debts.

loans.use: to buy gum, candies, chocolates, lollipops, etc.

loans.name: Helmo Tomas

texts.es:
Helmo tiene 42 años, pero se siente un joven de 20 años, vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 13 y 3 años;  son su adoración sobre todo porque el verlos es suficiente para seguir adelante y ser mejor por ellos cada día. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad donde alberga la mayor población afroperuana de nuestro país y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores tienen un don particular, cocinan de manera deliciosa y sobre todo son personas muy carismáticas y amables. Cuando Helmo dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta leer para distraer la mente y también le gusta degustar uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”.

Con mucho optimismo Helmo trabaja cada día en su negocio como chofer de mototaxi; el le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 12 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 35 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y tiene tarifas cómodas para el transporte de los mismos.

Helmo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general de su vehículo y pintarla ya que con el uso diario se han desgastado algunas partes, así el podrá dar más comodidad y seguridad a sus clientes, así mejoran sus ingresos y seguirá trabajando día a día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa de material noble y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia”.
texts.en:
Helmo is 42 years old, but feels like he is 20. He lives with his wife and two children aged 13 and 3 years. He adores them above all else as he sees them as all he needs to succeed and improve for them every day. His house is located in the city of Chincha. The city has the largest Afro-Peruvian population of the country and is home to great glories of Peruvian sport. The residents also have a particular gift of delicious cooking and above all are very charismatic and kind. When Helmo has free time he enjoys reading to distract his mind and also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious “Arroz Chaufa” (fried rice).

With much optimism, Helmo works every day in his business as a moto-taxi driver. He works around 12 hours a day and serves up to 35 clients per day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is nice to his customers and offers good rates for his transportation.

Helmo is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and thanks to the help they have given he is able to carry out general maintenance for his vehicle and paint it, as daily use has worn down the parts. He will be able to improve the comfort and safety for his customers, and improve his income so that he can continue to work every day to achieve his dream: "Making his home with good materials and providing a better quality of life for his family."

loans.use: to repair, maintan and paint his vehicle

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru:
Замире 35 лет, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей.  В 2000 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Замира начала бизнес в животноводстве, использовав для этого сумму в 25,000 сом (KGS). 
Замира трепетно и с большой ответственностью относится к своему делу - благодаря такому подходу, на сегодняшний день Замира имеет в своем хозяйстве 7 коз с приплодом, 4 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 лошадь и 6 жеребят. Несмотря на трудоемкий и объемный труд, который отнимает много времени, Замира также  занимается и полеводством, обрабатывая 0,5 га земли с клевером, кукурузой и картофелем. Ежемесячный доход от такого хозяйства составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS), часть которого откладывается на оплату дочери в университете. 

В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Замира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку кобыл для торговли кумысом (кобылье молоко). Доходы Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение поголовья.
texts.en:
Zamira is 35 years old, married, and is raising 4 children.  In search of an income for her family, in 2000, Zamira began her business in animal husbandry with 25,000 som (KGS).  Zamira does her work reverently and very seriously.  Thanks to this approach, today Zamira's farm has seven goats and their offspring, four cows, two calves, one horse, and six ponies.  Regardless of the vast amount of labor intensive work, which takes a lot of time, Zamira also farms.  She works 0.5 ha of land where she grows clover, corn, and potatoes.   Her monthly income from the farm comes to about 7,000 som (KGS), a part of which she sets aside for paying her daughter's university tuition.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Zamira applied to Bai Tushym & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) for purchasing mares so she can sell kumis (mare's milk).  Zamira is planning to invest the income in further increasing the number of her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Gabriel Antonio

texts.es: Gabriel de 50 años vive (Quevedo Ecuador ).el  trabajaba anteriormente en otra cosa pero como le fue mal y se quedo sin trabajo empezó a vender cangil y papitas y le resulto le va bien .  y desde ese entonces se dedica a la venta de papas y canguil. Es  vendedor ambulante trabaja todos los días  junto a su esposa  tiene 5 hijos y están en escuela fiscal . la dificultad que tiene es el clima. A futuro el anhela terminar de arreglar su casa . con el préstamo comprara ( canguil caramelo ect ).
texts.en: Gabriel is 50 and lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. He worked before doing something else, but it didn't go well and he ended up without a job. He started to sell popcorn and potato chips and it went very well for him. Since then, he has sold popcorn and potato chips. He is a street vendor and works every day with his wife. They have 5 children and they go to public school. His problem is the weather. In the future he wants to finish fixing his house. With the loan, he will buy popcorn, candies, etc.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, utensils, and candy.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. victoria  tiene 35 años no es casada pero es madre soltera con un hijo que tiene la edad de  10 años, se dedica a la venta de  papa por mayor, en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados de la localidad de Sacaba,   este préstamo se encuentra en su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Victoria utilizara  este préstamo para compra de papa por mayor y de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para adquirir mas mercadería, la Sra.  Victoria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y quiere ofrecer una variedad de papas para tener más clientela, utilizara los beneficios  en aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo más productos para su venta mejorar sus ingresos y por ende tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Victoria is 35 years old. She is not married but has a 10 year old son. She sells potatoes wholesale in her spot in one of the markets in the town of Sacaba,. This loan is her second cycle with the institution. Victoria will use this loan to buy potatoes wholesale and thus increase her working capital. The reason for this loan is to buy potatoes wholesale and thus increase her working capital. The reason she is asking for this loan is she doesn't have enough money to acquire more merchandise. Victoria faces challenges in her business such as competition. She wants to offer a variety of potatoes in order to have more customers. She will use the money to increase her working capital, acquiring more products to sell and improve her income, therefore having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo, photographed in the auto repair work shop he has.

Mona is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and a mother with one son and two daughters. 

For the past 14 years, Mona's husband has had a workshop for repairing and painting autos, located in an area that has a few workshops of this sort. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income for the family.

Mona is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new auto repairing kit. This will enable him to improve the quality of his work and increase the family's income to help them live in better conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new auto repairing kit.

loans.name: Djatou

texts.fr:
Agée de 30 ans, Djatou vit avec ses  3  enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Djatou s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements, de tissus et de pagnes wax. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs.  
Djatou est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 rouleaux de tissus de différentes qualités auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Djatou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Djatou is 30 years old and lives with her 3 children and her husband in a traditional family setting in Fakola, the principal town of a rural community.

Unable to attend school, Djatou quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, most notably the buying and selling of clothing, wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African sarong-like clothing) and fabrics. She is highly valued and sought out in Fakola and the surrounding region.

This is Djatou's 1st loan from Soro Yiriwaso and it will be used to buy 4 rolls of mixed-quality fabrics from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her merchandise, for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the markets of Fakola and surrounding communities, to a clientele made up of men and women. Djatou hopes to make a month profit of 60 000 francs, which will be used to help her husband provide for the household needs and repay the loan, and be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He is age thirty-seven and married with four children between the ages of fifteen and four years. He has employed one farmhand and sells his produce of milk, maize and vegetables to the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business besides the farming business.

Francis has requested a third loan from Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 82,400 KES, after the first and second ones of 30,000 KES and 60,000 KES respectively. He will use the third loan to buy and insure a dairy cow at 62,400 KES and construct a dairy unit at 20,000 KES. He hopes to have five dairy cows in five years and rank among the leading suppliers for the local processing plants in the area.

He appreciates the Juhudi Kilimo loan services but says animal food shortages and diseases still remain a challenge.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He has been in active in farming for over seventeen years. He is age thirty-eight and married with six children between the ages of sixteen and two years.

Moses has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He is optimistic he will be able to meet his family's basic needs and educate the children with his farming income.

Moses says the major challenge in farming for the residents is the poor roads network which delays delivery of produce to the markets.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is age 42 and has been farming for five years. She employs one farmhand to help with her farm's producing and with selling eggs and vegetables. She also runs a tailoring shop which generates additional income to that of farming. She is married and has three children between the ages of fourteen and eight years.

Teresia has made a loan request amounting to 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She believes the acquisition of a dairy cow through a loan will earn her good income and help in improving the living standards of her children, with milk being available for the family consumption besides being sold to repay the loan, as well as meet other of the family's basic needs.

For Teresia, the major challenge in farming is caused by animal diseases which eats into their farming income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus is a resident and farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is age 25 and married with three children between the ages of eight and three years. His farm produces milk, tomatoes and eggs for the local market. He has been farming for five years and currently employs one farmhand.

Protus has requested a loan of 52,000 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes this will enable him to improve his income significantly to meet family needs and help him increase the number of his dairy cows to three within five years.

He laments that high costs of animal feeds, coupled with their regular treatment, remains a challenge.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married to Joyce. Together they have one child. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past seven years.

This is his first loan. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is already registered with KADET. Samuel will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

He hopes to boost his farming so as to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a water tank and irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Ines Margarita

texts.es: Ines  de 46 años vive ( Quevedo Ecuador ). Ella decidió entrara a este negocio para mejorar su situación económica .y ayudar a sus hijos en lo que podía . tiene 8 hijos solo tiene 4 a cargos de ellas es separada . trabaja todos los Dias con mucho esfuerzo y ganas ella y sus hijas la ayudan en lo necesario . la dificultad que tiene es la enfermedad y la delincuencia . a futuro ella anhela tener su casa propia y mejorar su negocio . con el préstamo comprara ( sillas mesas ect).
texts.en: Ines, who is 46 years old, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She decided to start this business in order to better her economic situation and help her children in any way that she can. She has 8 children, only 4 of which are in her care, as she is separated. She works every day and puts a lot of effort and will into it. Her daughters help her when needed. The difficulties she faces are sickness and crime rates. In the future, she hopes to have a house of her own and to make her business grow. With this loan, she will buy chairs and tables.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wamalwa

texts.en:
Wamalwa is age 48 and married with seven children between the ages of twenty-one and two years. He has been farming for seven years. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He is also involved in a motorcycle transport business. His farm produces milk and vegetables which he sells within the local market.

He has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says he hopes to get enough milk for family consumption as well generate more income from the milk sales to meet other family needs.

Wamalwa says the challenge remains animal diseases and food shortages during dry seasons. However, he remains optimistic with the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, a resident of the Kitale area of Western Kenya, has practiced farming for over 35 years, employing one farmhand and producing milk, maize and beans for the local market. He is a married father of 10 children between the ages of 32 and 14 years, the last four still in school. His family entirely depends on farming for their upkeep.

Michael is now requesting a loan of 83,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure two dairy cows. He says the income from the cows will help boost his farming income which he will use to pay school fees for his children.

While lamenting the frequent fluctuations in milk prices, Michael is glad to have joined Juhudi Kilimo for its loan services, and focuses on timely repayment of the loan and hopes to acquire larger amounts in the future.

loans.use: to buy and insure two dairy cows.

loans.name: Geoconda Carolina

texts.es: Geoconda de 19 años vive ( Quevedo Ecuador ) . ella decidió entrar al negocio de la costura porque desde pequeña su padre le enseño. A parte ella estuvo en un curso de corte y confecion . ahora ella se puso su propio taller de costura . trabaja todos los días sola con mucho esfuerzo y ganas es madre soltera  tiene  1 hijo . a futuro anhela tener su negocio mas amplio y darle a su  hijo lo que necesite . con el préstamo comprar ( telas hilos ect ).
texts.en: Geoconda, who is 19 years old, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador. She decided to go into sewing because she was taught by her father since she was a child. She also completed a course in cloth cutting and designing. She now has her own sewing workshop. She works every day, putting a lot of effort and will into it, and is a single mother of one child. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and to give her child what it needs. With this loan, she will buy various types of cloth and thread.

loans.use: to buy cloth and thread.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 24 years old and married to Peter, has operated an M-pesa shop (mobile-phone-based money transfer service) for the past two years, earning a monthly income of KES 25,000. Now requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to increase her business float, she will use the additional profits earned to open another M-pesa branch.

Janet's dream is to buy a car and a plot of land for her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: to apply for more float for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Agée de 45 ans, Mariam vit avec ses  deux enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle élargie, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Mariam s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente de poissons séchés et fumés. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs par les restauratrices et ménagères.  
Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, Mariam est à son deuxième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 5 gros paniers de poissons à partir de la république du Sénégal. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée essentiellement d’hommes et de femmes. 
Mariam espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mariam is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a traditional, extended family setting in Fakola, the main town of a rural community. Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Mariam quickly became interested in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of dried and smoked fish. She is highly regarded and much sought-after in Fakola and the surrounding region by restaurateurs and housewives.

Having correctly repaid her first loan, Mariam is on her second, which will be use to buy 5 large baskets of fish from the Republic of Senegal. She sells her wares for cash or credit, door-to-door and at the markets of Fakola and surrounding communities, to a customer base comprised of men and women. Mariam hopes to make a monthly profit of 200 000 francs which she will use to support her husband with the household needs, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Nelson Javier

texts.es:
Nelson, un joven de 25 años, el cual vive en la comunidad los Ranchos, en las afueras de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de Leña , con este negocio mantiene a su esposa y sus tres hijos.  El inicio a los 17 años con esfuerzo propio pues recorría grandes caminos vendiendo leña y también sandia pues su pobreza no le permitió seguir estudiando solo finalizo la primaria.  
El usara el crédito para comprar 2 llantas y rines nuevos que necesita para su carretón y también para comprar un lote de leña para vender. Uno de sus proyecto que desea realizar es sembrar hortalizas y frutas pues durante esta época la demanda de frutas y hortalizas es muy buena.
texts.en: Nelson, a young man of 25, lives in the village of Los Ranchos, on the outskirts of the city of León. A salesman by trade, he sells firewood; his business supports his wife and their three children. He started when he was 17, with great efforts, since he travelled extensively to sell firewood as well as watermelons. Due to his being poor, he finished only primary school and was not able to continue further. He will use this loan to buy 2 new rims and tires, which he needs for his cart, as well as a stack of firewood to sell. One of the projects he wishes to accomplish is to plant vegetables and fruit, since at this time of year the demand for these products is quite good.

loans.use: to buy 2 new rims and tires, which he needs for his cart, as well as a stack of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Moumine

texts.fr:
Né vers 1974 à Nièssoumana, Moumine vit avec ses 3 enfants et sa femme dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie dans la commune rurale de Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, Monsieur Moumine s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des animaux (bœufs, chèvres, moutons etc.)  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Moumine est à son premier prêt  avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 10 bœufs dans le village de Finiko et environnants. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant et en détail, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans les foires  de Fakola et Farako à une clientèle composée essentiellement de bouchers, de revendeurs et d’éleveurs. 
Moumine espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les affaires.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Nièssoumana, Moumine lives with his wife and 3 children in a large, traditional family setting in the rural community of Fakola. Not having had the opportunity to go to school, Moumine quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, most notably the buying and selling of animals (oxen, goats, sheep, etc.). He is held in high regard and much sought-out in Fakola and the surrounding region.

Moumine is on his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to buy 10 oxen in the village of Finiko and the surrounding area. He makes his sales, for cash or credit, in the Republic of the Ivory Coast and the markets of Fakola and Farako, to a customer base principally composed of butchers, resellers and breeders. Moumine hopes to make a monthly profit of 125 000 francs, which he will use to take care of his family's needs, repay the loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy oxen.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnas is 65 years old and has been active in farming for six years. He produces and sells poultry and milk to the local market. He also carries out a retail business in the local market to supplement his farming income. He is married with six children, between the ages of 18 and 30.

Barnabas has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. This is his second loan with Juhudi Kilimo, after the first one of the same amount. He says the acquisition of an additional dairy cow will improve the family's milk production and living standards. His goal is to own at least five dairy cows.

Barnabas, however, says farmers are facing great challenge due to animal diseases. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for their loan products.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina works hard to support her family. Celestina is married and has a retail business selling purified drinking water and soft drinks in the Philippines.

Celestina has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more purified water and soft drinks to sell to customers.

Celestina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Celestina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more purified water and soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes works hard to support her family. Agnes is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Agnes has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent and snack foods to sell in her store.

Agnes has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent and snack foods to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle works hard to support her family. Anabelle is married and has a food business in the Philippines.

Anabelle has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Anabelle has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 42 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ana Marie is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ana Marie has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from electronic loading.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is photographed in his store which he is preparing to open as part of his project. 

Jihad is a twenty-seven-year-old single young man. He is preparing to open a store to sell mobile phones and their accessories to customers. This will be a profitable project as there is high demand for this type of goods. 

Jihad is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help cover the costs of purchasing mobile phones and collections of their accessories. This will enable Jihad to prepare well for the opening of his store and will allow him to offer a wide variety of mobile phones and their accessories for sale. This will help to increase sales and improve Jihad's income and create a bright future for him.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phones and their accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Tene

texts.fr:
Agée de 38 ans, TENE vit avec ses  3  enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire, à Fakola, un chef lieu d’une commune rurale. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, TENE s’est vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente d’habillements et de pagnes wax. Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée à Fakola et environs
TENE est à son quatrième prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 15 pièces de pagnes wax de différentes qualités auprès des grossistes de Kolondièba et de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes, au comptant et en détail, à domicile, au marché de Fakola et dans les foires environnantes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
TENE espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités.
texts.en:
Tene is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a nuclear family environment, in Fakolo, the principal town of a rural community. Not having had the opportunity to attend school, Tene quickly became engaged in revenue-generating activities, notably the buying and selling of clothing and wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African material). She is highly valued and much sought out in Fakola and the surrounding area.

Tene is on her 4th loan, which will be used to buy 15 pieces of wax pagnes of mixed quality from the wholesalers in Kolondièba and Bamako. She sells her merchandise for cash, door-to-door, at the markets of Fakola and surrounding communities, to a retail clientele made up of men and women. Tene hopes to earn a monthly profit of 75 000 francs, which she will use to help her husband provide for the family, repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and child. He is trying his best and working hard in order to be able to satisfy his family's needs. After many years of experience in repairing and selling wheels, Ali decided to open his own shop in 2007. Today, he is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase extra products, such as wheels, for his business and to renew his tools, as well. This Kiva loan will boost his business and allow him to attract new customers. In the future, he plans to work as a wheels trader.

loans.use: to purchase extra products, such as wheels, for his business and to renew his tools, as well.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and three siblings, one of whom is working. His father, who has been serving in the Lebanese army, takes care of the family. In order to help him, Taha decided to work independently as a plumber; he has been doing this since 2009. 

Taha is brave and highly professional. Today, he wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional plumbing tools for his new projects. He notes that this will help him carry on his work in a proper way. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing tools shop.

loans.use: to purchase plumbing tools for new projects.

loans.name: Anees

texts.en:
Anees is photographed in his store.

Anees is a 22-year-old single young man. He has had a mobile phone store for six months, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Anees is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more mobile phones for sale and improving the store's condition such as installing new shelves and installing additional lights. This will offer to Anees a better collection of mobile phones in his store, which will increase sales. Improving the store's condition to have better look will increase Anees' income.

loans.use: To purchase more mobile phones for sale and improve the store's condition

loans.name: Jehan

texts.en:
Jehan is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Khaled appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Jehan is a 27-year-old young woman. She is married to Khaled who is a construction contractor who works with his father and gets a salary, which is not enough to cover all life's costs.

Jehan is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies, such as tiles, bleaching and painting, to finish a number of stores he has in order to lease them. This will enable Jehan's husband to improve the stores' condition and have the opportunity to lease them to customers soon, which will increase and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to finish a number of stores he has to lease

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh (pictured working in his office) is a 26 year-old married man who doesn't have children yet.

For the past three years, Hamzeh has operated a business that offers public services like: translating documents, printing and copying materials and papers, and typing. This has been a profitable endeavor and his only source of income.

Hamzeh is requesting a $3,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing computers, a copier and a printing machine in order to improve the quality of his work. This will increase the size of his business and also improve his family's income.

loans.use: to purchase computers, a copier and a printing machine for his business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old, young man who is engaged and preparing to be married soon. He is a worker who has a low salary that is not enough to cover his wedding expenses. 

Ali is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing new home furnishings such as bedroom, living room, and dinning room furniture to prepare for his wedding . This will provide him suitable home furniture and will help him get his home well-prepared before he gets married. 

Ali is photographed above in his house which he will soon live in with his coming wife.

loans.use: to purchase necessary home furnishings for his wedding.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en:
Nayef is photographed in his store for selling car accessories. He is a 23-year-old single young man, and he lives with his family of 12 members. His mother is a school teacher and his father is not employed.

For the past five years, Nayef has been operating a store for selling car accessories, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but which helps to cover his family's costs and needs.

Nayef is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing car accessories in bulk to sell. This will increase sales, especially because his is the only store for selling car accessories in the area where he lives, which will positively lead to improving the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase car accessories in bulk.

loans.name: Sa'dya

texts.en:
Sa'dya is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sa'dya is a 28-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a schoolteacher who earns a salary, but not enough to cover all the family's needs and costs.

Sa'dya is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing a new computer, which will help him to prepare the necessary and requested reports and exams for his students. This will enable him to improve his work and enhance his skills in using a computer, and help him prepare requested school documents on time.

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Domel

texts.en:
Domel currently resides in Estefania with his spouse and five children. His primary sources of income are derived from backyard hog raising, farming and his transportation service. He has owned and operated a van transportation service for almost three years. Domel is thankful that his businesses enable him to pay his children's school expenses.

He is now requesting a loan of P14,000 to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of the van to ensure the continued smooth operation of his transport service and the good income it generates. Someday, with continued effort, patience and faith in God, Domel will achieve a successful life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for franchise renewal and maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario and his spouse have seven children. The youngest is attending school. The rest have finished their education and have settled into marriage. 

Mario and his spouse work untiringly selling fruits and vegetables to the people in the village where they live. The family's vending business generates good income through affordable prices and friendly service. Mario is also known to be humble. 

He is now borrowing a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell. He hopes this loan will be granted to him as a way of improving and diversifying the business. 

Mario is praying for good health and a profitable business to achieve financial independence for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, tomatoes and a sack of rice to sell.

loans.name: Muhayokhon

texts.ru: Мухайёхон трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Она замужем и заботливая мать одного ребенка. В настоящее время её муж находится в России на заработках, и она сама содержит свою семью. Она работает бухгалтером в дехканском хозяйстве, её зарплата не хватает ей на покрытые  семейных расходов и дополнительно занимается купле- продажей скота и земледелием. Имеет 2 гектара земли, где выращивает плодовые деревья. На данный момент посеяла кукурузу на корм скоту. В обороте она имеет 6 голов крупного и 8 голов мелкого рогатого скота. С прибыли она купила себе автомашину марки «Тикко» и использует машину для своего бизнеса. Мухайёхон запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для урожайности земли и покупки скота для увлечения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Muhayokhon is a hardworking and good woman. She is married and the caring mother of one child. Currently her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation, and she supports the family herself. 

Muhayokhon works as an accountant at the dekhan farm, her salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses, and she is engaged in buying and selling of livestock and agriculture in addition. She owns to acres of land, where she grows fruit trees. Currently she has sown sweet corn as livestock fodder. She owns six heads of cattle and 8 heads of small livestock. For the profit she has bought a car (of the brand Tikko) and she uses this car for her business. 

Muhayokhon requests a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers for the productivity of the land and the purchase of livestock for increasing the herd.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and livestock

loans.name: Sultonboi

texts.ru: Султонбой женат и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Имеет семилетний опыт в скотоводстве и занимается купле продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он выращивает и откармливает 6 голов крупного рогатого скота с  телятами. Султонбой по специальности  тракторист и работает на Акционерном Обществе и получает хорошую зарплату. Также он имеет 0,75 соток земли и выращивает кукурузу на корм скота. Султонбой запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью увлечения поголовья скота. Султонбой надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en:
Sultonboi is married and is raising two children. He has seven years of experience in cattle breeding and he is engaged in buying and selling cattle. He raises and fattens six heads of cattle with calves. 

Sultonboi is a tractor-driver by profession, works at the company and receives a good pay. Further he owns 0.75 acres of land and he grows sweet corn to feed the cattle. 

Sultonboi requests a loan for the purchase of cattle, with an aim to increase the cattle heard. He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Wadea

texts.en:
This is Wadea, 33, a resident of Sana`a, Yemen. He is married and a father of two children. He manages their household while operating his business. He is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses. 

Wadea operates a pharmacy. He earns by getting medicines from different companies and selling by the packet. He started his business by working as an employee in a company which enabled him to open his business. He requested a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy medicines for his business.

Wadea hopes to grow his business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business.

loans.use: to buy medicines for his business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 23 years old and she is married to Daniel. Together they have two children. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for the past one year.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET client.She will use the loan to purchase clothes for sale.

She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: tp purchase stock of used clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a jolly person. Despite poverty in life, she still has the determination to succeed. Jesusa has eight children. Two of them attend high school.

Jesusa operates a small variety store in front of her house at Estefania. She would like to acquire more customers and generate good profits from her business. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy additional items to vend. She will buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice. 

Jesusa would like to make the business more profitable in order to earn funds for the college education of her children. When they earn degrees, they will find good jobs for the welfare of their own lives someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and three sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a hardworking and loving husband. He is 26 years old and has one child. His wife spends full time in nursing their child. 

To earn an income, Jonathan sells beef and pork. He buys the meat at the public market and resells it at their village for profit. He has been doing this for two years now and earns PHP 3,000 each month.

He is now borrowing PHP 7,000 to buy more beef and pork meat to resell. He would like to continue operating this business and earn good profits for the sustenance of the family. In the future, he will also established a hog-raising business for an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy more beef and pork to resell.

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada lives peacefully at Libag, with her spouse. She has three children. One is working abroad and the rest have their own families and live separately with them. 

Iluminada is thankful for earning profits from her business of hog fattening and breeding. Through her business, she has been able to buy food for daily meals and pay for electric bills. Iluminada has four piglets. She would like to strengthen her business. As of now, she is borrowing PHP 33,000 to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feed. 

Iluminada would like to ensure proper growth of hogs that will lead her to earn good profits from it. With enough funds, she will able to establish a better pigpen for her hogs.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, medicines and hog feed.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is aged 41 and married with seven children, aged between twenty and one year old. He has been in farming in his rural home in Kitale, Western Kenya for over five years and employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize and eggs for the local market. He also runs a motorcycle transport business.

Andrew has requested a loan of 82,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow at 52,000 KES and build a zero grazing unit at 30,000 KES. This is his fourth loan with Juhudi Kilimo after the previous three of 10,000 KES, 45,000 KES and 80,000 KES respectively. He expects to get more returns from farming owing to his experience which runs to five years.

He reiterates that joining Juhudi Kilimo for its loan services has been a great boost to his milk production and income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow and construct a zero-grazing unit

loans.name: Daouda

texts.fr:
Né vers 1973 à Kolondièba, DAOUDA vit avec ses 8 enfants et sa femme dans une famille traditionnelle à Fakola. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Monsieur DAOUDA s’est vite intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat vente des  céréales mil, riz, maïs, fonio, arachide, etc.  Il est très apprécié et sollicité à Fakola et environs.  
Nanti de 3 années d’expériences dans le domaine, DAOUDA dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son  deuxième prêt, après avoir correctement remboursé le précédent. 
DAOUDA compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de fonio auprès des paysans producteurs  des villages. Il effectue ses ventes au comptant en détail et quelques fois à crédit, en république de Côte d’Ivoire et dans la foire de Fakola à une clientèle  diverse et variée.
