loans.use: To buy home products and new toys.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 30 years old, married, and has four children; three of them are still in school. 

Yar heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer this is her fourth loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 2000 Sudanese pounds in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is photographed next to the bedroom furniture she will purchase.

Ghada is a 42 -year-old woman. She is married and a mother with one son. Her husband is employed, earning a with low salary, which is not enough to cover his family's needs and costs.

Ghada is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing  dining room furniture and bedroom furniture for her only son. This will enable Ghada to offer better, comfortable home furniture for her family.

loans.use: to purchase bedroom furniture and dinning room furniture.

loans.name: Yolanda Guadalupe

texts.es: Yolanda de 36 años vive ( suburbio Guayaquil). Ella empezó haciendo manualidades de fomix y cerámicas. Yolanda decidió hacer un préstamo. y con ese dinero compro ropa y se dedica ahora a vender ropa en su local .con mucho esfuezo y mucha dedicación trabaja todos los días. A futuro ella  deseacomprarse una casa  y aumentar su negocio. Con el préstamo comprara ( ropa, adornos para el hogar).
texts.en:
Yolanda, 36, lives in Suburbio, Guayaquil.  She began making crafts with Fomix [a type of crafting foam] and ceramics.  Yolanda decided to get a loan and with the money she bought clothing.  Now she works selling clothing in her place.  She works with a lot of effort and dedication every day.  In the future she wants to buy herself a house and expand her business.

With the loan she will buy clothing and home decorations.

loans.use: to buy clothing and home decorations.

loans.name: Edilma Elizabeth

texts.es: Eldilma de 34 años vive ( fortin Guayaquil) ella empezó en un cursO DE BISUTERIA . le gusto entonces decidió ponerse su propio en casa. Ella trabaja todos los días con esfuerzo y dedicación. A futuro ella desea mejorar su situación económica y mejorar su casa. Con el préstamo comprara ( hilo brochas etc)
texts.en: Eldilma, 34, lives in Fortín, Guayaquil.  She started taking a course in costume jewelry making.  She liked it so decided to set herself up at home.  She works every day with effort and dedication.  In the future she’d like to improve her economic situation and improve her house.  She will use the loan to buy thread, brushes, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread and brushes.

loans.name: Maria Candida

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 46 años de edad, es casada y sin hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con su esposo, en el caserío Tejedores, en el distrito de Tambogrande. La localidad ya cuenta con algunos servicios básicos.
La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la venta de leche fresca en dicho caserío ya que cuenta con 8 cabezas de vacunos productoras de leche y además tiene ganado ovino y aves de corral. Se dedica a la venta de leche y crianza de animales hace más de 10 años. La actividad se la reparten entre esposos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente.
El monto del crédito asciende a 3000 nuevos soles, los cuales serán invertidos en mejoras en su vivienda, específicamente en cambio de calaminas en techo de la misma, por estar estas en mal estado.Además una parte se empleará para asistir cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
María is a 46 year old woman who’s married and has no dependent children.  She lives in her own house with her husband in the Tejedores settlement in Tambogrande District.  The location has some basic utilities.

The activity she carries out is sale of fresh milk in said settlement; she has 8 head of dairy cows producing milk and she also has sheep and barnyard fowl.  She has sold milk and raised animals for more than 10 years.  Both spouses share the work and mutually support each other.

The loan request is for 3000 new soles that will be used to do some home improvements, specifically replacing the metal roof sheeting because it’s in poor shape.  She will also use part of the loan for corn crop maintenance.

loans.use: to make some home improvements and to provide crop maintenance.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Khitam is a 39 -year-old woman. She is married and a mother with four sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker, earning a low income, which is not enough to cover his family's costs.

Khitam is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing bedroom furniture for her children and a kitchen table. This will improve the family's home living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 26 years old, married, and has 2 children. He does a bicycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. He describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 52,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 32 years old, married, and has 2 children. He sells used shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He describes his business customers as low income earners because they live in slums. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Dushirukumwete Group

texts.fr:
Jacqueline fait partie du groupe Dushirukumwete, elle habite à Gitega. Elle a 38 ans et est mariée à Elias, commerçant de banane et de manioc. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants.

Elle est   commerçante de banane et manioc depuis 22 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter d’autres produits commerciaux comme le riz,à revendre,  pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années elle voudrait  acheter de grandes propriétés de terre pour entreprendre le projet agropastoral moderne.
texts.en:
Jacqueline belongs to the Dushirukumwete group. She lives in Gitega. She is 38 years old and married to Elias, a vendor of bananas and manioc. 
They have three children together. 

Jacqueline has been selling bananas and manioc for 22 years. She is on her second loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, she will bolster her working capital and buy more goods for resale, for example rice, in order to gain more revenues.
In the years to come, she would like to buy large land plots in order to launch a modern agricultural business.

loans.use: to buy more goods for resale, for example rice, in order to gain more revenues.

loans.name: Luis Franco

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive junto a su esposa y la adoración de sus ojos que son sus 2 pequeñines, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, asimismo es una ciudad que tiene como actividad principal la agricultura y sobre todo por la generosidad de sus pobladores. Anteriormente Luis ha trabajado como albañil, y como agricultor con lo cual llevaba el sustento para su hogar pero no era mucho y empezó a trabajar manejando mototaxi, en una mototaxi alquilada desde hace 4 años; hace 1 año logro ahorrar y pudo comprarse una mototaxi en la cual labora actualmente. Luis trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable y atento con los clientes.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar llantas, reparar el motor, comprar un faro y realizar el mantenimiento de su mototaxi, con lo cual tendrá mucho más seguridad no solo para el sino para los clientes, así seguirá trabajando para luchar cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Comprar 2 motos e iniciar una pequeña empresas de mototaxis”
texts.en:
Luis is a happy, hardworking man, who lives with his wife and two small children whom he adores. His house is located in Imperial, a primarily agricultural city known for its year-round hot climate and the generosity of its residents. Previously, Luis had been a construction worker and a farmer. He was able to support his household, but his income was low. Four years ago, he leased a motor taxi and started working as a driver. A year ago, he was able to buy the motor taxi he uses now with the money he had saved. Each day Luis works about 10 hours and has about 20 customers. He believes his business is going well because he is friendly and attentive to his customers.

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered him, he will be able to buy tires and a headlight and maintain and repair the motor. Then his motor taxi will be much safer, not only for him but also for his customers. He will keep striving every day to make his great dream a reality: "to buy 2 motor taxis and start a small taxi business."

loans.use: to buy tires and a headlight for his motor taxi and to do motor maintenance and repairs.

loans.name: Javier Enrique

texts.es:
Javier vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año.  Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello uno de sus platos favoritos es el riquísimo “Arroz Chaufa”, cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le encanta ver televisión ya que lo distrae cuando esta de mal humor. El estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Arquitectura.

Cada día Javier sale a trabajar con mucho entusiasmo en su negocio de carpintería, el elabora puertas, roperos, entre otros, el le dedica a su negoció alrededor de 9 horas diaria, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable con la entrega de los pedidos de sus clientes y sobre todo que realiza trabajos de calidad y bonitos con lo cual sus clientes siempre lo recomiendan.

Javier está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cortadora circular, ya que actualmente el tiene que alquilar esta herramienta o pedirla prestada; con esta mejora el tendrá su propia herramienta y podrá realizar mejor sus trabajos, así podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una local propio de Carpinteria”.
texts.en:
Javier lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions which is the “Laguna de Huacachina;” another one of its tourist attractions is the famous “Bruja de Cachiche” which is visited by an infinity of tourists all year round.  Like all good Peruvians, he enjoys the country’s traditional dishes and one of his favorites is the very delicious “Arroz Chaufa.” [Chinese style fried rice]  When he has free time he loves to watch television since it distracts him when he’s in a bad mood.  He studied up to fifth year of secondary school but would have liked to study architecture.

Every day Javier goes out to work with much enthusiasm in his carpentry business.  He makes doors and armoires, among others.  He spends around nine hours daily at work.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very responsible with delivering orders to customers and above all because he does quality, beautiful work so his customers always recommend him to others.

Javier is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help they are giving him he will be able to buy a circular saw because he currently has to lease this tool or ask to borrow one.   With this improvement he’ll have his own work tool and will be able to do his work better thus improving income and continuing to strive toward reaching his great dream: “ To have my own carpentry shop.”

loans.use: to buy a circular saw.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
En el municipio de Achuapa departamento de León está habita  el Joven Roger,  es una zona que se ha caracterizado por ser agropecuaria. Él  tiene una finca en la cual ha invertido mucho porque es un medio que le permite obtener el desarrollo para su vida familiar, cuenta con tres hijos los cuales dependen de él, su principal actividad es la ganadería.

Actualmente  se presentó por primera vez  a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de cinco Novillos para  engorde, ya que cuenta con todas las condiciones en su propiedad, Esto le permitirá obtener un mejor potencial de producción e desarrollo a su propiedad lo cual  le permitirá incrementar su inventario ganadero y así podrá continuar comercializándola en su localidad y sin ningún inconveniente.
texts.en:
Young Roger lives in the municipality of Achuapa in León Department.  It’s a zone that’s noted for farming and animal husbandry.  He has a farm that he’s invested a lot into because it’s a means of obtaining development for his family life.  He has three children who depend on him and his main activity is raising cattle.

At present, he’s come by Ceprodel for the first time to request a loan to buy five calves to raise since he has all required conditions to do so on his property.  This will allow him to obtain better production potential and development of his property which will allow increase in herd size to continue selling in his location problem-free.

loans.use: to buy five calves.

loans.name: Enrique Camilo

texts.es:
El señor  Enrique Camilo, es una persona  que se dedica a la  crianza de terneros para  engorde, actualmente solo vive con su esposa, donde los dos se enfocan en sacar adelante su negocio,  él tiene experiencia en este sector, se siente contento de su trabajo ya que la comunidad donde el habita es perfecta para realizar su actividad. 

Se presentó a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dos terneros para  crianza y engorde de novillos. Está consciente que esta institución  apoya a este tipo de personas y espera que este le  sea otorgado para así iniciar su incremento productivo en su actividad de ganadería.
texts.en:
Enrique Camilo is a person who raises calves.  He’s currently just living with his wife and both of them focus on moving their business ahead.  He has experience in this sector and feels happy with his work since the community where he lives is perfect for it.

He came by Ceprodel to request a loan to buy two calves to raise and fatten up.  He’s aware that this institution helps his type of person and hopes that it will be granted so that he can start to increase production in his cattle-raising activity.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, organic manure and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria Ofelia de 34 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta crianza de animales y venta de ropa tipica,desde hace 7 años nos cuenta que con el credito anterior pudo agrandar un poco mas la crianza de animales,y le da gracias a Dios y a kiva por el apoyo que le dieron,ahora ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de alimentos para animales,y compra de ropa tipica espera que kiva les pueda dar ese apoyo que nececita para seguir progresando con su negocito.
texts.en: Maria Ofelia is 34 and raises domestic animals as well as selling typical clothing, which she has done for the past 7 years.  With a former loan, she was able to increase her animal stock, and is grateful to Kiva for its support.  She seeks this credit to buy animal feed as well as to buy typical clothing, and hopes that this support will allow her to continue to grow her small business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and typical clothing.

loans.name: Jack Willard

texts.es:
El Joven Jack Willard actualmente tiene su propio empleo, donde desempeña el cargo de administrador en el   Municipio de santa Rosa del peñón, él es una persona  con espíritu de superación en la vida, su familia se conforma por sus  cinco hijos y su esposa  dependientes de él,   tuvo la oportunidad de conocer que  Ceprodel que apoyaba a las personas para mejorar su Vivienda. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de sementó, arena y pago de mano de obra, para una mejor calidad de vida  de su Familia, de igual manera Ceprodel apoya a este tipo de persona, debido a que le ha motivado a seguir luchando para lograr vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Jack Willard currently has a job; he is an administrator in Santa Rosa del Peñón municipality. He is a person who is looking to improve his life. His family comprises his wife and five children who depend on him. He found out that Ceprodel has helped people make improvements to their homes. 

He came to request a loan to purchase cement and sand and pay for labor, since Ceprodel helps people do this. This has motivated him to keep striving to provide his family with a better quality of life and more suitable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tiverio Enrique

texts.es:
Tiverio es un hombre divorciado de 41 años, padre de tres hijos con quienes vive. Ellos son: Jóselin de 19 años, Gabriel de 17 años y Ronaldo de 15. Juntos residen en "Nanegal" ubicado en "Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos de "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Hace 17 años Tiverio trabajaba como ayudante en una carpintería, y decidió independizarse y abrir su propio taller con los conocimientos aprendidos y su espíritu emprendedor. Trabaja 12 horas al día y es ayudado por un sobrino. Es difícil ser el único sustento para su familia pero Tiverio es un hombre luchador y ha dado a sus hijos todo lo necesario para tener una vida modesta. Este hombre quiere renovar sus herramientas de trabajo y comprar madera para así poder tener mayores ganancias. Este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa, que es la institución intermediaria entre Tiverio y el portal KIVA. El recibirá además del dinero que necesita, capacitación y asesoría para que su inversión sea de mejor provecho.

Ha pasado obstáculos grandes en su vida como el divorcio de su esposa, sin embargo ha sabido seguir adelante con sus hijos. Su sueño es poder tener un taller grande y dar trabajo a más personas que como el aman la carpintería.
texts.en:
Tiverio, 41, is a divorced man, father of three children that live with him.  They are: Jóselin, 19, Gabriel, 17 and Ronaldo, 15.  They live together in Nanegal located in Los Bancos which is a rural canton in Pichincha Province where the capital city of Ecuador is located.  One of Los Bancos’ main resources is hydrologic since several streams and waterfalls originate here which become rivers of considerable size.  This canton has quite a bit of commercial movement, especially farming and livestock products as well as veterinary services and stores selling basic staple items for residents’ daily consumption.

Seventeen years ago Tiverio was working as an assistant in a carpentry shop and he decided to become independent and open his own shop with the skills he’d learned and his enterprising spirit.  He works 12 hours daily and is helped by a nephew.  

Being the only source of support for his family is difficult but Tiverio is a tenacious man and has given everything so his children could have all that’s necessary to live a modest life.  This man wants to upgrade his work tools and to buy lumber in order to have higher profits.

This is his first loan with Fundación Alternativa which is the intermediary between Tiverio and Kiva.  Besides the money he needs, he will also receive training and guidance so that his investment will be of the most use.

He has gone through large obstacles in life, like his divorce from his wife.  However, he’s known how to continue forward with his children.  His dream is to be able to have a large shop and to provide employment for others who love carpentry like he does.

loans.use: to upgrade his tools and to buy supplies.

loans.name: Harold

texts.es:
Harold es un padre de familia que se gana la vida impartiendo clases de primaria a niños del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actividad que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y que gracias a esto también ha mejorado su vivienda poco a poco donde hoy en la actualidad tienen mejores condiciones de vida.
Se acercó por primera vez a Ceprodel para  que le brinde el apoyo de otorgarle un crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra ya que tiene la necesidad de reparar un dormitorio de su vivienda para continuar mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia y por ende tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en: Harold is the father of a family and teaches primary school to children in Santa Rosa del Peñón, allowing him to support his household and to improve his housing little by little, resulting in better living conditions.  He approached Ceprodel for a first time credit in order to buy para cement, sand, steel and to pay wages for laborers, as he needs to repair a bedroom of his house to better provide for his family and assure them a secure dwelling.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, steel and to pay wages for laborers.

loans.name: Apriyani

texts.en:
Apriyani is a 23-year-old lady who is married to Ayub, a 23-year-old man. They have a daughter named Ajeng, who is 1 year old. To assist her husband in generating money for their family, Apriyani runs a business producing various snacks such as banana crispy chips, fried corn, and “kue rambut,” a traditional fried cake made of rice flour mixed with palm sugar. 

Everyday Apriyani distributes the products from one kiosk to another. She also distributes them to the other districts. She believes that the business has good prospects for the future and enables her to generate more income for the family. Apriyani is thinking of enlarging the business by providing snacks in a large quantity. Therefore she is requesting a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from TLM. She would like to spend the loan on wheat flour, rice flour, banana, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice flour, banana, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana, 40 years old and a married lady, has two daughters and two sons. She has been selling clothes at home recently, mainly to friends, relatives, and neighbors. She also added selling accessories to her clothes selection. 

She has applied for this loan to buy more accessories and new spring clothes.

loans.use: to buy more accessories and a new spring clothes selection

loans.name: Jorge Amadeo

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes del país, el cual es la “Laguna de Huacachina”, asimismo otro de sus atractivos turísticos es la famosa “bruja de Cachiche”, la cual es visitada por infinidad de turistas en cualquier época del año. Jorge ha pasado por muchas cosas tristes, una de ella es que se quedo huérfano de madre cuando era pequeño  y por ello solo tiene un solo apellido, fue criado por una tía y desde ese entonces el ha luchado mucho por salir adelante, desde pequeño tuvo que aprender a trabajar y ganarse el pan con el sudor de su frente.

Jorge se dedica a su negocio de venta de desayunos a las afueras del mercado de su ciudad; trabaja alrededor de 7 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 45 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque Dios siempre ha estado con él a pesar de los problemas que pudiera haber pasado y también porque está ubicado en un lugar muy concurrido y atiende de una manera amable sus clientes.

Jorge está agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una mesa y sillas para que sus clientes se sientas mas cómodos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su sueño:” Tener su casa propia”
texts.en:
Jorge is a very hardworking young man.  He lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for having one of the country’s most important tourist attractions which is the “Laguna de Huacachina.”  It also has another famous tourist attraction, the famous “Bruja de Cachiche” that’s visited by infinity of tourists all year round.

Jorge has undergone many sad things.  One of them is that he was orphaned at a very young age which is why he only has one last name.  He was raised by an aunt and he’s striven much since then to get ahead.  Since he was little he had to learn how to work and earn his daily bread with the sweat from his brow.

Jorge sells breakfasts outside his city’s market.  He works about 7 hours daily and can see up to 45 customers per day.  He believes that he does well in his business because God’s always been on with him despite the problems he’s had and also because he’s situated at a very busy spot and because he treats his customers very kindly.

Jorge is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to buy a table and chairs so that his customers will feel more comfortable which will allow him to improve income and continue striving daily to make his dream a reality: “To have my own house.”

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood to make chairs and tools etc.

loans.name: Najiya

texts.en:
Najiya is a conservative person, so she asked her husband Khaled to take her place in the photo. 

Najiya, 39 years old and a married woman, has six sons and one daughter.  Her husband owns a scrap shop from which he supports the family, in addition to their eldest son’s salary.

Now Najiya wants to help her husband in improving his business, so she has applied for this loan in order to expand the place and organize it to add more scrap in the future.

loans.use: to expand the place and organize it to add more scrap materials in the future.

loans.name: Shahinaz

texts.en:
Shahinaz is a conservative person,  so she has asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

Shahinaz, 36 years old and a married woman, has three boys and a daughter. Her husband Yaser is a freelance transporter and owns a pick-up that he uses for this purpose.

Shahinaz  does embroidery at home to help by adding another source of income for the family. Now she has applied for this loan in order to buy a new sewing machine so she can expand in the future and open a big tailoring workshop.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Hafeetha

texts.en:
Hafeetha, a 52-year-old married woman,  has two boys and two girls. Her husband is a driver at a private company.

Hafeetha has been knitting and embroidering for the last two years. During this period she was able to market her products in home products shops since most of her embroidered products are bed covers, pillow covers, and table cloths.

Now Hafeetha want to increase her productivity and make more items so she can open her own shop and sell her own products, so she has applied for this loan to buy more thread and fabric to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy more thread and fabric

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana Julia es madre soltera quien tiene a su cargo a su única hija a la que le ha dado conforme 
Sus posibilidades lo mejor en educación y condiciones económicas.
Se gana la vida impartiendo clases de educación primaria a niños de todas las edades en una comarca aledaña al municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón donde tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad la que le ha permitido construir poco a poco su propia vivienda y sacar adelante por si sola a su hija.
Tiene año y medio de trabajar con Ceprodel lo cual desde que le otorgaron su primer crédito han sido para invertirlos en su vivienda lo que agradece este apoyo que  es beneficioso para el   desarrollo económico  muchas familias en Nicaragua, ayudan a cumplir dichos sueños de tener un techo digno donde vivir.
Cabe mencionar que es el octavo crédito que solicita para la compra de piedra, cemento, bloques, hierro y pago de mano de obra con el fin de construir un dormitorio para tener más espacio y comodidad.
texts.en:
Ana Julia is a single mother of one daughter, who she has provided for as well as her education and economic conditions have allowed.
She teaches primary school to children of all ages in a village school in Santa Rosa del Peñón, and has done so for several years.  Her work has allowed her to build her own house and provide for her daughter.  She has worked with Ceprodel for 1 1/2 years, and used her first credit to invest in her housing; she is grateful for this support which has benefitted many Nicaraguan families in achieving their dreams of economic progress and improved living coniditions.  This will be her eighth credit, which she plans to use to buy stones, cement, blocks, steel, and to pay wages for laborers, in order to build a more spacious and comfortable bedroom.

loans.use: to buy stones, cement, blocks, steel and to pay wages for laborers.

loans.name: Abelino

texts.es: El señor  Abelino es una persona responsable que  día  con día se  preocupa  por acondicionar  su  vivienda,  en este  momento requiere  pintar las  paredes del exterior  de  su  casa, ya  que  nos  comenta  que  desea  que  su hogar tenga  una  mejor  imagen esto debido a que la pintura con la que  cuenta  actualmente esta  un poco  deteriorada,  agradece  el apoyo  brindado  para   hacer de su  sueño una  realidad  ademas de que esta  muy  contento  de   habernos  encontrado por la facilidad que proporcionamos para  realizar  los pagos.
texts.en: Abelino is a responsible person who day to day strives to improve his home.  At the moment, he wants to paint the exterior walls of the house because he says that he wants his house to have a better appearance because the paint it currently has is somewhat deteriorated.  He is grateful for the support provided to make his dream a reality and he’s also very happy to have found us because of the easy payment plans we provide.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of his house's walls.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes tiene 30 años y es casado con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 8 y 4 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de carteras y ropa en general su negocio se encuentra en la zona de  Alto Sopocachi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mercedes utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción de sus tienda, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio, y este es uno de los retos que enfrenta la Sra.  Mercedes, le va muy bien en su actividad desea con el tiempo tener mas clientela, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y por ende la calidad de vida de toda su familia, la Sra. Mercedes se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 30, is married and has two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  She sells purses and clothes in general.  Her business is located in the Alto Sopocachi zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.

Mercedes will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to make improvements to her store.  The reason for requesting the loan is to expand the business and this is one of the challenges Mercedes faces.

She does well in her activity and in time would like to have more customers to improve income and thus her family’s quality of life.  Mercedes feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha, 46 years old and a married woman, has two sons and two daughters. 

After her husband retired from the military, he started working as a freelance pick-up driver. But Muntaha wanted to help her husband as he is getting older, so she has been making a special type of yogurt that is well-known in Jordan called "jameed". "Jameed" is used in the Jordanian traditional famous dish called "mansaf" that everyone loves to eat.

She also make ordinary yogurt besides "jameed", and she wants to start making more dairy products so she has applied for this loan in order to buy a special machine that can help her expand and make more products.

loans.use: to buy a special machine to use to start making more dairy products

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, 40 years old and a married woman, has three daughters and one son, the eldest among her children. She has a small retail business selling clothes. She uses her husband's experience when buying the clothes since he is a merchant and owns a distribution shop. For that reason, Iman gets good quality clothes at a reasonable price and sells them for a good price. 

Now Iman wants to increase the amount of products she has to increase her revenue so she can one day open a clothing shop, and for that reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to present a spring selection of clothing

loans.name: Hind

texts.en: Hind, 43 years old and a married woman, has no children. To fill her time doing something useful, Hind started to make crafty decoration pieces and embroidery. She also makes different kinds of dishes per order. Now she has applied for this loan to buy more tools and materials to make new crafts.

loans.use: to buy more tools and materials to make new crafts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 30 years old and married with two children. He has a taxi transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years and describes his business environment as favorable because he has many regular customers. To earn extra income he does dairy farming. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en: Ezekiel is 37 years old, married with three children. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many regular customers. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold is 34 years old and tailors to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed two people. To earn extra income he sells packaged water and juice. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business, and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material to make clothes.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material to make clothes.

loans.name: El Pedregal Group

texts.es:
Oscar es uno de los integrantes del grupo El pedregal el cual esta integrado por 4 personas las cuales viven en la comunidad de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera y en sus alrededores la gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña.

Oscar tiene la edad de 28 años, solo estudio la primaria  y es soltero, el nos platica que desde muy pequeño sus padres lo en señaron a trabajar para ganarse la vida, pero hace un poco mas de 4 años decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de tortillas,( en esta reguion se acostumbra que el tortillero llega a la puerta de tu casa a vender sus tortillas esta actividad la realizan por medio de motos y en la parte de atras amarran un canasto en el cual tranporta sus tortillas)ya que tenia su moto, el inicia su trabajo todos los dias desde las 6:00 de la mañana va a comprar las tortillas y porteriormente sale a venderlas por todas las calles de su comunidad, como el ya tiene varios años en este trabajo ya tiene muchas clientas lo cual hace que su trabajo sea un poco mas facil. el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de tortillas y dar mantenimiento a su moto. el desea que con este credito su negocio continue prosperando y cada dia tener mas clientes para que sus ganancias aumenten.

los demas integrantes de este grupo son:
alicia venta de antojitos
blanca venta de ropa 
Martin servicio de electricista
texts.en:
Oscar is a member of the El Pedregal Group. This group has 4 members who live in the community of Acatlan de Perez Figueroa that is known for being located in the sugar cane belt and everyone works in the planting and growing of sugar cane. 

Oscar, 28, didn’t finish school and is single. He tells us that his parents taught him how to work for a living at a very young age. Four years ago, he decided to open his own tortilla business (in this region, it is customary for the “tortilla man” to sell tortillas door-to-door by putting a basket on his motorcycle and transporting his tortillas from house to house). He owns his motorcycle so he starts his work day by going to buy tortillas at 6am and then selling them on the streets of his neighborhood. Since he’s been in this line of work for several years, he already has many clients which makes his work a little easier. He needs this loan in order to invest in buying tortillas and for the maintenance of his motorcycle. He hopes that this loan will help his business to continue prospering and that he will gain more clients every day in order to increase his income.

The other members who make up this group include Alicia who sells snacks, Blanca who sells clothing and Martin who is an electrician.

loans.use: buy and sell tortillas.

loans.name: La Lomita Group

texts.es:
El grupo La lomita esta integrado por 5 mujeres muy unidas y trabajadoras, ellas viven en una comunidad llamada Acatlan de Perez Figueroa la cual se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera a solo 15 minutos del ingenio la margarita uno delos principales productores de azúcar de la región, en esta comunidad la gente se dedica al comercio y al cultivo y siembra de caña. los integrantes de este grupo son: sita venta de ropa, constancia venta de pollo, olivia venta de ropa, Maria del Rosario venta de calzado y Lorena venta de calzado.

la señora sita tiene la edad de 25 años, solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Rodolfo con el cual tiene dos hijos. doña Sita nos platica que hace algunos meses decidió iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de ropa para ganar un poco de dinero extra y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa ofreciendo sus productos a sus amigos y vecinos, Ella dice que gracias a Dios su negocio va creciendo poco a poco y cada dia tiene mas clientes. Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la Compra de variedad de Vestidos, faldas, flusas, pantalones, short, camisas, playeras y ropa interior para continuar con sus ventas. Doña sita desea que con este credito su negocio continue creciendo ya que en un futuro le gustaria que sus hijos estudien una profesion.

El grupo la lomita eagradece a kiva y a la fundacion el apoyo que se les esta brindando
texts.en:
The “La Lomita” (The Little Hill) group is composed of five very united, hardworking women.  They live in a community called Acatlán de Pérez Figueroa which is noted for being in a sugarcane producing zone only 15 minutes from the La Margarita sugarcane plantation one of the region’s main sugar producers.  In this community people are merchants and sugarcane farmers.  The members of the group are:  Sita, who sells clothes, Constancia who sells chicken, Olivia who sells clothes, María del Rosario who sells footwear and Lorena who also sells footwear.

Sita, 25, only completed elementary school.  She’s married to Rodolfo and they have two children.  Sita tells us that a few months ago she decided to work at her own clothes sales business to earn extra money to help her husband with household expenses.  She sells house to house offering her products to friends and neighbors.  She says that thanks to God her business has been growing little by little and every day she has more customers.

She needs the loan to buy an assortment of dresses, skirts, blouses, pants, shorts, shirts, t-shirts and underwear to continue with her sales.  Sita hopes that with this loan her business will continue to grow because she’d like her children to study a profession in the future.

The La Lomita group thanks Kiva and the Fundación for the support they are providing.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 28 years old and married with two children. He does tailoring to earn a living. He has been in the business for 12 years and describes his business environment as busy because he has many customers who visit him regularly. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine

loans.name: Los 3 Arbolitos Group

texts.es: Este Grupo solidario se llama Los 3 arbolitos, está conformado por la señora Herlinda va a comprar con su préstamo llantas, parches, cadenas, las señoras Adriana y Paula van a comprar pollo por mayoreo, la señora Margarita va a comprar blusas, pantalones, camisa, faldas, la señora Victoria va a comprar huevo, arroz sabritas, refrescos, la señora Felicita va a comprar chicharrones, mangos, pabellones. La señora Victorina tiene 41 años de edad, ella se separo de su esposo, ella tiene 5 hijos 3 mujeres y 2 varones, estudian 4 de sus hijos 1 varón en la primaria, 1 varón en la secundaria, 1 mujer en la secundaria, 1 mujer en la preparatoria, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotas, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar escobas, jabón, aceite, crema, queso, papel higiénico, clarasol, mechudos, maíz quebrado, chile guajillo, pasilla, frijol, arroz, azúcar, ella inicio su negocio hace 4 años, empezó con poquito con 3 cajas de refrescos y un poco de todo y vio que si se vendía y con los créditos fue creciendo, ella también vende taquitos de sudadero, carne enchilada y longaniza su hija mayor le ayuda a atender a los clientes que llegan a comprar taquitos. Su negocio es importante porque tiene ingresos para sus hijos, ella se siente orgullosa de tener su negocio comenzó con poco y fue creciendo la tienda, ella utiliza las ganancias  una parte para los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos, otra parte para invertir en mercancía, ella está planeando ampliar su tienda vender jitomates, tomates, chiles, ajos, cebollas, papas, verduras y lo piensa lograr con las ganancias de las ventas de los tacos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son comprar un terreno, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos nos ayudan a seguir adelante con los negocios”.
texts.en:
This group is called the three little trees. The group includes Herlinda; she will buy tires, patches and chains. Adriana and Paula will buy wholesale chickens. Margarita will buy blouses, pants, shirts and skirts. Victoria will buy eggs, rice, and soft drinks. Felicita will buy pork rinds and mangos. 
Victorina is 41 years old. She is separated from her husband. She has five children, three girls and two boys. Four of her children are in school. One boy is in primary school. One girl and one boy are in secondary school. And one girl is in high school. 
She has a grocery store. She is requesting a loan to purchase brooms, soap, oil, cream, cheese, toilet paper, Clarasol (a cleaning product), mops, coarsely ground corn, guajillo and pasilla chiles, beans, rice and sugar. Victorina started her business four years ago. She started small with three cases of soft drinks and a little bit of everything. She saw that she sold these things and with the loans, the business was growing. She also sells sudadero (beef brisket) tacos, meat enchiladas and sausages. Her older daughter helps her to wait on customers who buy the tacos. 
Her business is important because she has income for her children. She feels proud to have started her business with very little and growing her business. She uses the earnings in part for her children’s school expenses. Another part is invested in merchandise. She is planning expand her store in order to sell tomatoes, chiles, garlic, onions, potatoes, vegetables. She thinks she will achieve this will the earnings from the taco sales. Her dreams and hopes are to purchase a plot of land and for her children to continue studying. The members of the group want to say to Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad, “thank you for the loans that help us to move ahead with the businesses”.

loans.use: purchase brooms, soap, oil, cream, cheese, toilet paper, Clarasol (a cleaning product), mops, coarsely ground corn, beans, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his Internet booths and buy iron rods, etc.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 45 años de edad, vive en Soledad, con su esposo y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 10 a 23 años. Ella se dedica a una  actividad comercial, la cual  inició hace 7 años con una miscelánea que mantuvo durante tres años y cuando  su esposo recibió la pensión laboral,  decidió enfocarse en la comercialización de celulares de alta gama y accesorios para los mismos, pues las ventas de la miscelánea habían descendido. Así fue como respondiéndole a este desafío, logró hacer rotar más rápidamente su mercancía, en la actualidad  ha agregado antenas de una empresa importante, de la cual hoy es distribuidora; en su negocio vende de contado y también hace créditos a sus fieles y buenos clientes. Sus compras las realiza de contado aunque también tiene proveedores que le ofrecen crédito.  Con su negocio ha logrado apoyar el bienestar de su familia y en la actualidad sus hijos se encuentran estudiando carreras técnicas y sueña con verlos realizado profesionalmente, por eso su meta inmediata es fortalecer su negocio, pero su mayor desafío es lograr el capital de trabajo suficiente, para actualizar permanentemente su inventario. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará Celulares, accesorios como carcasas, baterías, manos libres, memorias, su inversión será exitoso porque aumentará su surtido pues existe una demanda de los artículos actualizados  y su experiencia le marca el camino a seguir.
texts.en:
Mónica, 45, lives in Soledad with her husband and she has five children whose ages range between 10 and 23 years.  She carries out a commercial activity that she started seven years ago with a variety store that she had for three years.  

When her husband received his work pension, she decided to focus on selling high end mobile phones and accessories because sales in the variety store had declined.  This is how she started to respond to this challenge.  She managed to turn over her merchandise quickly and she’s now added antennas from an important firm that she’s now a distributor for.  

She sells for cash but also on credit for her good, regular customers.  Her purchases are cash although she also has some suppliers that extend credit to her.  

With her business she’s been able to support her family’s wellbeing and her children are currently studying technical careers and she dreams with seeing them fulfilled professionally which is why her immediate goal is to strengthen the business.  However, her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital to permanently update her inventory.  

This is the reason behind her calling upon her Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories like cases, batteries, hands-free headsets and memories.  Her investment will be successful because she will increase her inventory and because demand exists for updated items and her experience points to the path she must follow.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer de 33 que se dedica a la venta de sándwiches con el fin de sacar, sola, a su hija de 7 años adelante. Luzmila es separada desde hace algún tiempo, pero esto no la detuvo para demostrarse a sí misma y a su pequeña que ella sería el sustento para su familia.

Luzmila empezó a vender en su carrito sándwichero desde hace un año, tiempo en el que ha aprendido como realizar la preparación adecuada para sus productos. Ella tuvo algunos problemas familiares y fue por ello que decidió empezar en este tipo de negocio debido a que era práctico, ya que solo tiene que sacar su carrito en las tardes y noches, fuera de su casa.

Luzmila está contenta de gozar con buena salud, ya que hasta el momento no tiene ninguna decadencia y esto le permite esforzarse más y más. Con el apoyo que se le está brindando ella podrá comprar embutidos, papas al hilo y otros productos con el fin de que sus clientes tengan mucha más variedad. Luzmila está muy contenta por la ayuda que se le está brindando. Con el tiempo desea poder incrementar sus ganancias, lo que la llevará a cumplir su gran sueño “ Tener su propio Restaurant”.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a woman who is 33 years old and makes a living selling sandwiches with the goal of raising her 7-year-old daughter alone.  Luzmila has been separated for a while, but this has not prevented her from demonstrating to herself and to her little girl that she would be the provider for the family.

Luzmila started selling from her sandwich cart a year ago, during which time he has learned how to properly prepare her products.  She had some family problems, and for that reason she decided to start this type of business since it was practical and all she had to do was take her cart outside her house during the afternoons and evenings.

Luzmila is happy to have good health.  Up to this point she has not had any decline in health and this allows her to work harder and harder.  With the support that she is provided, she will be able to buy sausages, French fries, and other products, so that she can offer her customers greater variety.
Luzmila is very happy for the support she is getting.  With time, she would like to increase her earnings, which will help her reach her big dream “to have her own restaurant”.

loans.use: to buy sausages, French fries, etc.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a businessman. He has a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 30 years old and married with two children. He sells small dried fish (omena) to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. To earn extra income, he runs a cereals store and sells firewood. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standards and he hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy small dried fish (omena) to sell.

loans.use: To buy small dried fish (omena) to sell

loans.name: Ana Ermelinda

texts.es:
ANA ERMELINA TIENE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD ES DIVORSIADA NO TIENE HIJOS, VIVE CON LOS PADRES EN SAN MIGUEL DE BOLÍVAR.

ANA SE DEDICA A AYUDAR EN UN RESTAURANTE, SOLICITA EL CRÉDITO COMPRAR MESAS, SILLAS, COSINA, OLLAS, MANTELES. 

CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO PODRÁ COMPRAR LO NECESARIO PARA PONERCE EL PROPIO NEGOCIO UN RESTAURANTE.

LAS COMPRAS LO HARA EN GUARANDA. EL SUEÑO E SPODER CONSTRUIR UNA CASA.

 EL DESAFÍO AL QUE SE ENFRENTA ES SEGUIR ADELANTE CON EL NEGOCIO. EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE LE GUTS AVER TELEVISIÓN.
texts.en: Ana Ermelia, 41, is divorced; she has no children.  She lives with her parents in San Miguel de Bolívar.  Ana works as a helper in a restaurant.  She’s asking for the loan to buy tables, chairs, a stove, pots and tablecloths.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy what’s needed for her to open her own restaurant.  She will make her purchases in Guaranda.  Her dream is to be able to build a house.  The challenge she faces is to continue forward with the business.  In her free time she enjoys watching television.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, a stove, pots and tablecloths.

loans.name: Elias Jose

texts.es: El señor Elías es dueño de un pequeño tramo ubicado en el mercado  en el cual se comercializa ropa nueva para  hombre y mujer como pantalones y camisas entre otros desde hace 4 años. Tiene 2 hijos ambos asisten a la escuela primaria este su segundo crédito Kiva el primer crédito lo invirtió en su negocio y aumento el tamaño de su inventario fue de mucha ayuda para su negocio esta muy agradecido por el apoyo recibido de Kiva actualmente solicito el crédito para invertir en comprar shorts al por mayor, camisetas que son muy usados durante esta  época de  verano que es cuando sus ventas  experimentan incrementos.
texts.en:
Elías owns a small space in the market where he’s been selling new clothes for men and women like pants and shirts, among others for four years.  He has two children both of which are attending elementary school.  

This is his second Kiva loan.  He used the first loan to invest in his business and increased the size of his inventory.  It was of much help for his business and he’s very grateful for the support he got from Kiva.

He’s currently requesting the loan to buy shorts at wholesale and t-shirts that are very popular during the summer season which is when his sales increase.

loans.use: to buy shorts and t-shirts.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is a businesswoman. She is married with three children. She sells mats and fabric to earn a living. She has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as competitive because many people do the same business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her living standards and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy mats and fabric to sell.

loans.use: To buy mats and fabric to sell

loans.name: Colombe Group

texts.en:
Jacques, age 56, is married with five children. Four of his children are attending school. He operates a butcher shop in a local market in Brazzaville.

He has had this business for 21 years! He has gained many valuable customers and a lot of business experiences over the years. Jacques will use the loan to buy more fish, chicken, and beef to sell in his shop. When asked about difficulties he has with his business, Jacques responded that he needs larger loans. He is a very hard working ambitious entrepreneur! 

Jacques has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. He hopes to one day be able to travel outside of Brazzaville to buy meat. He wants his children to be successful and would like to see them work for HOPE Congo.

loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Marina, age 22, is a single mother with two children. Both of her children are attending school. She runs a small bakery where she sells pastries and cakes in a local market. She has had this business for seven years. Marina will use the loan to buy sugar and flour. Her strategies are to offer good quality products and to bake and sell the most popular products. She tries to provide what her customers like best. 

Marina has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a very good repayment record. The rain poses a great difficulty to her because her stand in the market does not keep out the rain. She hopes to build a more fortified stand and, as she grows, to eventually build a boutique. She will continue to receive loans from HOPE Congo because they are helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar and flour.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel de 49 años de edad y madre de dos hijos en las edades de 25 y 27 años, tiene un pequeño taller de confecciones, actividad que aprendió por tradición de su madre y su abuela quienes se dedicaron también al mismo oficio. Cuando Maribel inició lo hizo ayudándolas y haciendo vestidos de muñecas y en la medida en que iniciaron sus ganancias, ahorró para comprar sus primeras máquinas que aun conserva y son de mucha utilidad. En la actualidad se dedica a la confección de uniformes, que vende a estudiantes de varios colegios de la ciudad, pero su mayor desafío es actualizar sus procesos productivos porque la infraestructura con la que cuenta no le permite hacer bordados ni pegar botones. En la actualidad Maribel está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará  una maquina moderna para agilizar sus trabajo y desarrollar otras alternativas productivas como el bordado y pegada de botones. Su inversión resultará exitosa, porque aumentará la efectividad de su tarea productiva y potencializará la oferta de servicios que no solo aplicará a sus prendas, sino que pueden ser opciones generadoras de ingresos.
texts.en:
Maribel is 49 years old and the mother of two children, ages 25 and 27.  She has a small sewing shop, a job she learned in the tradition of her mother and grandmother, who worked at the same job.  When Maribel began she did it helping them and making doll outfits, and as she earned profits, she saved to buy her first machines.  She still has them and they are very useful.

Currently she works making uniforms that she sells to students in various schools in the city.  Her greatest challenge is updating her production methods, because the infrastructure she has does not allow her to do embroidery or button application.
 
Maribel is requesting a Kiva loan with which she will buy a modern machine to make her work easier and develop productive alternatives such as embroidery and button application.  Her investment will be successful because it will increase her work productivity and improve the services she offers.  Not only will this apply to her garments, they also can be options for generating income.

loans.use: to buy a modern machine.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Cecilia,   es una clienta antigua de la institución que por la  proximidad de su domicilio siempre solicita crédito en la agencia, demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la avaluación que se la hizo, además por el buen historial crediticio que demostró en los anteriores créditos, La Sra. Cecilia vive en la zona alto San Pedro, de la ciudad de la paz Bolivia, la Sra. Cecilia se dedica a la elaboración y envasado de crema de árnica actividad donde le va muy bien ya que tiene mucha clientela, también tiene un café internet por la zona y por este motivo solicito el crédito que es para la compra de una maquina computadora, la Sra. Cecilia  es muy trabajadora y además abnegada con su trabajo, ella tiene la voluntad de que con trabajo, va un día tener su negocio en un lugar mas comercial y con mayor producción y rentabilidad, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a longstanding client of the institution who because of the nearness of her home always seeks credit from the agency.  She behaved nicely and courteously during the evaluation she underwent.  In addition, she established good credit history with her previous loans. 

Cecilia lives in the Alto San Pedro zone in the city of La Paz, Bolivia.  Cecilia works making and bottling cream of arnica, an activity she does well in because she has a large clientele.  She also has an Internet café in the zone and this is why she’s asking for the loan to buy a computer.

Cecilia is very hardworking and self-sacrificing at work.  She’s convinced that with her willingness to work one day her business will be more commercial, productive and profitable.  She is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Les Enfants Unis 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Silvere, age 37, is a single father with two-year-old twin boys. He owns a butcher shop in a local market.

He has operated this business for one and a half years. He purposely located himself in a specific community where there was not a butcher shop. He feels this has been an important factor in his business' success.

Silvere will buy a refrigerator and a small generator. The electricity in Brazzaville is unreliable and, if it is off for too long, his meat will spoil. The generator will allow him to keep his freezers and refrigerator running even if the electricity goes out. 

Silvere has received three previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a very good repayment record. As he continues to grow, he wants  eventually to transport live fish to Brazzaville from the coast. This will allow him to stock a greater variety of fish as well as offer very fresh fish to his customers. He hopes that his two boys will be successful and wants to be able to provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and small generator.

loans.name: Andrea Amy

texts.en: Andrea is a trained educator from Alabama. She has spent her life striving to help educate young people in her community. After being a teacher for years, she went back to school to receive her Masters in Education. With this degree, she aspires to open her own, home-based education center for children 4 - 14 years old to teach them advanced math. She hopes to educate up to 20 children a week in a very intimate setting, having four children to a session every day of the week. She also plans to dedicate her Saturdays to her business as well. On Saturdays, she will have special tutoring sessions for children who may have fallen behind or who need extra help in any given subject. She is asking for this loan to become part of a franchised educating community that will allow her the opportunity to have an online platform and that will allow her access to books and other materials that she will need for her classes.

loans.use: To purchase books and other materials and to set up an online platform for teaching.

loans.name: Jalapilla Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jalapilla esta integrado 4 mujeres alegres y trabajadoras cada una de ellas tuene una actividad economica la cual desarrollan con el objetivo de tener   mas ingresos economicos y asi poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de Aserradero a 10 minutos del municipio de Acatlan de Perez Figueroa en el estado de Oaxaca, esta comunidad se caracteriza por estar en una zona cañera y sus habitantes se dedican a la siembra y corte de caña de azucar.

Doña Eva es uno de los miembros de este grupo, ella  tiene la edad de 38 años y es madre soltera de un niño de nombre Diego de 15 años de edad que asiste a la escuela secundaria de Acatlan. Doña Eva nos platica que ella inicio trabajando fuera de casa de dependienta pero un día decidio  vender ropa interior por catalogo y se dio cuenta de que ganaba mas y tenia mas tiempo para estar a lado de su hijo y educarlo, ella tiene ya mas de 2 años vendiendo ropa interior, nos comenta que ella vende casa por casa, lleva los catálogos a sus clientes, levanta pedido lo encarga a sus proveedores y posteriormente cuando le llega el pedido lo entrega y recibe el pago por sus productos, ella vende en su comunidad y también sale a otros pueblos como Cosolapa, Tezonapa, Refugio y Motzorongo. Ella nos dice que decidió iniciar a trabajar ya que es madre soltera y tenia que vestir, calzar y alimentar a su hijo, doña Eva también tiene un pequeño corral en la parte de atrás de su casa en donde tiene unos borregos los cuales cría y después vende, ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de catálogos, ropa interior y alimento para sus borregos. 
Doña Eva espera que con este préstamo su negocio prospere y con sus ganancias poder vender sabanas y colchas; ella quiere seguir trabajando ya que quiere que su hijo en un futuro tenga una profesión. Doña Eva se encuentra agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad que le esta dando con este préstamo de que su negocio prospere y por la confianza que le a brindado al otorgarle este préstamo.

los demas miembros de este grupo son:
Veronica club de nutricion
Ana venta de cosmeticos
Maria club de nutricion
texts.en:
The “Jalapilla” group is composed of four cheerful, hardworking women.  Each of them has an economic activity she carries out in order to have more income and provide her family with a better quality of life.  This group is located in the community of Aserradero ten minutes from the municipality of Acatlán de Pérez Figueroa in the state of Oaxaca.  This community is noted for sugarcane production and its residents work planting and cutting sugar cane.

Eva is one of the members of this group.  She’s 38 years old and is a single mother of a 15 year old son, Diego, who attends secondary school in Acatlán.  

Eva tells us that she started out working outside the home as an employee but one day decided to sell underwear via catalogue and noted that she earned more this way and had more time to spend with her son and educate him.  She’s been selling underwear for more than two years now and she comments that she sells house to house.  

She takes the catalogues to her customers, takes their orders, places them with her suppliers and the when the orders are delivered to her she delivers them and collects payment.  She sells in her community and also goes out to other towns like Cosolapa, Texonapa, Refugio and Motzorongo.  She tells us that she decided to start to work because she’s a single mother and she had to clothe, shoe and feed her son.  Eva also has a small corral in her back yard where she has some sheep she raises to then sell.  She needs the loan to buy catalogues, underwear and feed for her sheep.

Eva hopes that with this loan her business will prosper and she will be able to use her profits to sell sheets and bedspreads.  She wants to keep working because she wants her son to have a profession in the future.  Eva is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it’s giving her with this loan so that her business can make progress and for the trust placed in her by granting the loan.

The other group members are:

Veronica-nutrition club
Ana-cosmetics sales
María-nutrition club

loans.use: to buy catalogues, underwear and feed for her sheep.

location.town: Aserradero, Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Lham-Erdene

texts.en: Lham-Erdene is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province in Southern Mongolia. Her husband works as a fireman in the wintertime. She started her garment retailing business in 2005. She brings the supplies from China and trades them at her well positioned shop counter in the town. The business has been successful and has made many regular customers. Lham-Erdene is a diligent and smart woman who says, "I would like to develop the business activities by buying the garments in large quantities so that I could save the transportation expense to China and save it for the future". The total amount she is requesting is 2,000,000 MNT to buy more garments.

loans.use: To buy more garments to sell

loans.name: Batzorig

texts.en: Batzorig is a 31-year-old man who lives with his wife and two daughters in the capital city of Mongolia. His wife is unemployed. He has been running a renting business in a public apartment. So far, he rents rooms to six families. The business has been successful and now he is planning to rent the garage of the building to a furniture factory. But the room needs to be repaired a bit to make it more comfortable. Batzorig is a hardworking man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by renting the garage so that I could raise the family income. I recognize that I have to be responsible for the family finance". The total amount he is requesting is 1,500,000 MNT to facelift the garage.

loans.use: To give the garage a facelift before renting it

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru:
Саламат 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей, младшему из которых 4 года. Саламат работает бухгалтером в сельской управе и в качестве дополнительного дохода -  с 2009 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Саламат имеется 3 головы дойных коров, 10 голов овец, 6 голов коз, доходы от продажи молока составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вложить в увеличение хозяйства за счет выращивании картофеля.
texts.en: Salamat is 44 years old, married and raising four children, the youngest of whom is four years old.  Salamat works as an accountant in the village governing office and, to provide additional income, has been involved in animal husbandry since 2009, having started this business with an initial sum of 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, Salamat's business contains three dairy cows, ten sheep and six goats; the earnings from sales of milk amount to about 5,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop her business, Salamat requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business due to growing potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
Silvia cuenta 23 años de edad, es casada tiene un hijo que esta estudiando 5° de primaria su esposo se llama Alfredo es campesino, ella se dedica al comercio tiene una tienda productos de abarrotes ya tiene con su negocio 3 años lo cual dice que le esta funcionando muy bien.
Silvia vive en una comunidad muy tranquila y su tienda la tiene en su casa así que sus clientes son sus vecinas, ella espera que le vaya muy bien con el negocio ya que le gustaría que creciera mas pero dice que ahora lo esta sacándolo adelante pues necesita de inversión, es por ello qie ella invertirá su préstamo en la compra de aceites, refrescos, jugos, leche, huevos, azúcar, fríjol, arroz, etc. Esta muy agradecida con su préstamo ya que éste le va a dar un gran empuje a su negocio.

Silvia pertenece al grupo 3 de mayo cuyo nombre es el nombre de la calle de donde vive el grupo esta integrado por 7 mujeres y 6 hombres en total 13 personas comprometidas con el trabajo a continuación serán mencionadas Rodolfo, Zurita, Andrés, Saturnino, Paciano, Inocencia, Mauro, Jovita, Alma, Victoria, Daniel, Emiliana, todos cuenta con una actividad comercial como son: venta de productos de abarrotes, maíz, ropa, carnicería, venta de pollo, refrescos, comida, dulces, frutas, etc.
texts.en:
Silvia, 23, is married and has a son attending fifth grade.  Her husband’s name is Alfredo and he’s a farmer.  She’s a merchant; she has had a grocery store for three years that she says is doing very well.

Silvia lives in a very tranquil community and her store is located at home so her customers are neighbors.  She hopes to do well with the business because she’d like it to grow more but she says that she’s moving it forward at present because she needs the investment and this is why she will use her loan to buy oil, soft-drinks, juice, milk, eggs, sugar, beans, rice, etc.  She’s very grateful for her loan because it’s going to give her business a strong push.

Silvia belongs to the “3 de Mayo” group.  Its name is the street where the members of the group live.  It has 7 women and 6 men, a total of 13 people committed to work who are listed as follows:  Rodolfo, Zurita, Andrés, Saturnino, Paciano, Inocencia, Mauro, Jovita, Alma, Victoria, Daniel and Emiliana.  They each have their own activity such as: the sale of groceries, corn, clothes, butcher shop, chicken sales, soft-drinks, food, candy, fruit, etc.

loans.use: to buy oil, soft-drinks, juice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: John Lester

texts.en: John Lester, a 25-year-old single man who lives in the Philippines, has been providing motorela or motorcycle services for three years. A member of HSPFI since 2011, he is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and gasoline for his service. In the future, John Lester hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase tools and gasoline for his transport service.

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозим житель города Исфара. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Нозим занимается торговлей. Он арендует помещение, где открыл продуктовый магазин. Этим видом деятельности Нозим занимается 13 лет. В торговле ему помогает жена. Он берет кредит для приобретения кондитерских изделий.
texts.en: Nozim is a resident of the city of Isfara.  He is 42 years old, married and has two children.  Nozim is involved in sales.  He leases a space, where he opened a food market.  Nozim has been involved in this business for 13 years.  His wife helps him with the sales.  He is requesting this loan to buy confectionery goods.

loans.use: to buy confectionery goods

loans.name: Davlatbek

texts.ru: Давлатбек житель района Дж. Руми. Он продолжает свою деятельность и берет кредит для закупа бычков и телят.
texts.en: Davlatbek is a resident of the J. Rumy district.  He continues his business and requests this loan to buy bulls and calves.

loans.use: to buy bulls and calves

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru: Мухаррам проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Три года как Мухаррам занимается торговлей. Она у себя во дворе продает лук оптом. Кредит берет для покупки лука.
texts.en: Muharram lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 57 years old, married and has two children.  She has a secondary education.  Muharram has been involved in sales for three years.  She sells onions wholesale in her yard.  She is requesting this loan to buy onions.

loans.use: to buy onions

loans.name: Grover Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Grover es cliente antiguo que trabaja como jardinero en un hotel cinco estrellas de la ciudad de la paz, desde hace tiempo y en domicilios particulares donde hace mantenimiento de los jardines, vive en la casa de sus suegros con su esposa Ángela ella es enfermera, no tienen hijos ambos trabajan, el Sr. Grover hace fumigados para el mantenimiento de jardinería trabaja independientemente con los fumigados en domicilios particulares,  El sr. Grover recientemente se compro un vehículo al cual se le hizo  mantenimiento ya que lo pondrá a trabajar, ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de llantas y fungicidas para su negocio, razón por lo que solicita el crédito, es una persona trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Grover is a former client who has been working as a gardener in a five star hotel and in private homes in La Paz.  He lives in his in-laws' home with his wife Ángela, who is a nurse. They do not have children and both of them work. Grover works independently when spraying for pests while caring for the private gardens.  

Grover recently bought a car that needed repairs so that it would run properly. Now he needs and is requesting a loan to purchase tires and pesticides for his business. He is a hardworking man who is grateful to the institution for the support offered to him.

loans.use: to buy tires and pesticides.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in Hovd province in Western Mongolia. His children study at college and high school. He has been running a meat retailing business for five years. He purchases the meats from a herder or herder families and his wife sells the meat at the Trade Center in their town. The business has been successful. Due to the price increases, they need to buy the meat in large quantities. Otgonbayar is a good-natured man who says, "I would like to expand the business activity by buying the meats in large quantities before they price increases". The total amount he is requesting is 1,000,000 MNT to buy meat.

loans.use: To buy meat to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma, a 36-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a business providing motorela or motorcycle services, with her husband as the driver, for the past five years. A new member of HSPFI, Thelma is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and gasoline for the business. In the future, she hopes to improve her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her transportation service.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр житель города Худжанд. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Бахтиёр занимается скотоводством. В этой области он 12 лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят с целью увеличения поголовья крупного рогатого скота.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 40 years old, married and has two children.  Bakhtiyor is involved in animal husbandry.  He has been in this business for 12 years.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves in order to increase cattle headcount.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Igualdad Group

texts.es:
la señora Soledad es uno de los 11 integrantes de un grupo llamado igualdad el cual se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar ubicada en una zona cañera en el estado de Oaxaca, la mayoria de sus habitantes se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de caña ya que a solo 15 minutos de encuantra el ingenio la margarita uno de los principales productores de azucar de la region.
